title: UI/UX Designer
description:
### **Your New Role**


We are now looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer to join an exciting transformation journey within Private Wealth Management & Family Office – a newly established business area focused on serving high-net-worth individuals.


In this role, you will support one of the Nordic region’s most established financial institutions in accelerating their digital offering for private banking clients. Traditionally, this segment has been built on strong personal relationships and in-person meetings. Now, the ambition is to complement that experience with intuitive, premium digital services – and you will be right at the heart of making that happen.


You will play a key role from the very start, working closely with both business and tech stakeholders to shape future digital experiences for a demanding and exclusive client segment.

**As a designer in this team, you will:**

* Design UI and UX for digital banking services, with a strong eye for layout, interaction patterns, color, and typography.
* Partner closely with a Channel UX Lead to conduct user research, define user flows, and create high-fidelity prototypes.
* Work in an agile setup together with product owners, developers, and fellow designers.
* Collaborate with a Design System team to ensure consistency, accessibility, and a premium feel across all digital channels aimed at private banking clients.

### **Company Presentation**


Our client is a leading player in the banking and finance sector with over 100 years of history – yet fully focused on the future. Driven by entrepreneurial thinking and innovative ideas, they describe themselves as an IT company with a banking license. Their Stockholm headquarters is the hub for digital transformation, where you’ll have the opportunity to develop advanced technological solutions shaping the finance of tomorrow. If you want to combine technology, innovation, and finance in a company that challenges traditional norms, this is the place for you.

### **Good to Know**

**Scope of employment**: Full-time, 100%  

**Type of contract**: Fixed-term employment as a consultant via JobBusters.  

**Working model**: Flexible, 3 days on-site.  

**Start date**: Beginning of January.  

**End date**: 2026-12-31, with the possibility of extension  

**Other information**: Background check before start.  

**In your application**: Please ensure that your CV clearly demonstrates how you meet the qualifications required by the client.

### **To succeed in this role, you will need:**

* Senior-level UI/UX design skills, with a clear emphasis on UI.
* An education in human–computer interaction, design, or equivalent professional experience.
* At least 5 years of experience designing digital interfaces for web, mobile, and apps.
* High proficiency in Figma.
* Fluency in English (Swedish is a plus).
* A strong sense of ownership, a problem-solving mindset, and a hands-on approach.
* Meritorious: Background in financial services / digital banking.

### **What we Offer**

* Secure employment with a collective bargaining agreement, insurance coverage and occupational pension
* Wellness allowance and employee discounts and offers via Benifex (e.g., health, leisure, transport and healthcare)
* Flex pension and access to the Lifeplan pension advisory service
* Additional compensation during parental leave
* Occupational health services
* Long-term assignments and a dedicated Consultant Manager for personal support
* Opportunities to build valuable experience, expand your network and grow your future career

### **We look forward to receiving your application**


We review applications on an ongoing basis. As recruitment processes in the consulting industry can move quickly, the position may be filled before the advertised deadline — so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.


You do not need to submit a cover letter. Instead, please respond to the screening questions included in the application process.

title: Konsultuppdrag | UI/UX design - Project HERO
description:
**Profile/Role: UI/UX designer**

**Expected years of experience: Level 3 (around 4-8 years)**

**Language skills: English, Swedish is a plus**

**Utilization: 100%**

**Start date: 1/1/2026**

**End date: 31/12/2026**

**Location/remote availability: Flexible, 3 days on site**

**CV & Matrix in English mandatory**

**Beskrivning:**

**UI/UX design - Project HERO**

**We recognize that the world of finance is evolving at an extraordinary speed. That's why we're committed to driving towards a more sustainable future for everyone — people, businesses, and society. Since we welcomed our first customer in 1856, we have been a catalyst for positive change by providing reliable advice and capital to people with ideas for the future.**

**Private wealth management & Family office is a new business division that is aimed at wealthy private individuals. The offering to this segment is today highly driven by the personal relationship between the client and the banker and the physical meeting, but going forward we want to accelerate the digital offering towards these clients. You will play a key role in the start of this initiative and collaborate close with other competences, both business and tech towards a common goal.**

**Kravspecifikation:**

**About You**

* **You believe that research and insights are crucial to ensure that design delivers real value.**
* **You believe the best way to create user friendly products is to continuously iterate on your designs.**
* **You are comfortable leading and participating in user research, customer feedback, and testing to shape and refine experiences.**
* **You enjoy being part of a team that adapts to what’s needed to move the customer experience forward.**

**As a designer in our team, you will:**

* **Design UI and UX for digital banking, with strong attention to layout, interaction patterns, colours and typography.**
* **Team up with the Channel UX Lead on user research, creating user flows, high-fidelity prototypes, and deliverables.**
* **Work closely with product owners, developers and other designers in an agile setup.**
* **Collaborate with our Design System team, ensuring consistency and accessibility across digital channels for private banking clients.**

**We are looking for someone with:**

* **Senior UI/UX design skills. Focus on UI.**
* **A strong ownership, problem-solving mindset, and hands-on approach.**
* **A minimum 5 years of experience designing interfaces for web, mobile and app.**
* **An education in human–computer interaction and design, or comparable experience gained through professional work.**
* **Highly proficiency in Figma**
* **Fluent in English, Swedish is a merit**

**Om oss**

*Senterprise är ett ledande rekryteringsbolag inom IT och en oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter. Med aktiv headhunting, search och djup teknisk förståelse hjälper vi några av Sveriges främsta arbetsgivare att hitta rätt kandidater, både för anställning och konsultuppdrag.*

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Product Manager
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise within IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Apply today, selection and interviews are ongoing.


We are now looking for a **Product Manager** for one of our clients.

**About Client**


We are transforming customer service, and we’re looking for an experience **Product Manager** to help lead the way. You’ll drive digital-first support powered by self-service tools, Gen AI chatbots, AI agents, and Agentic AI - making it easier for customers to help themselves while reserving human support for the moments that matter most.

**What you’ll do:**


Shape the next-generation support experience, from discovery to delivery and iteration.  

Translate customer and business needs into clear product requirements and priorities.  

Collaborate with UX, engineering, analytics, and stakeholders to launch seamless digital experiences.  

Define, track, and optimize key success metrics like deflection rate, CSAT, and chat adoption.  

Use experimentation and customer insights to inform strategic decisions and product improvements.

 **Who you are:**


Experienced Product Manager with a digital background, ideally in Retail, AI or customer support.  

Strong communicator and collaborator who thrives in cross-functional teams.  

Customer-focused problem-solver with a data-informed mindset and ability to prioritize impact.  

Comfortable with ambiguity, agile processes, and continuous improvement.  

Curious and proactive—always looking for smarter ways to serve customers and enhance the team’s ways of working.  

  

**Why you’ll love it:**  

You’ll join a global, cross-functional team dedicated to delivering exceptional digital support. You’ll work with diverse expertise in Product Design, Analytics, and Engineering, shaping a service that sets the standard for digital customer experience.

**Duration**: 2026-02-02to 2026-09-30

**Location**: Stockholm

**Application Deadline:** 2026-01-30


Please apply directly through our system with:

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.

**Please note:** We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

**Offer continuously:** Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Digital Analytiker
description:
**Jobba för originalet.**
-------------------------


Välkommen till Apoteket, nummer ett sedan 1971. Med visioner för framtiden och kvalitet i varje detalj, skapar vi förutsättningar för ett liv i hälsa. Hos oss utvecklas du i en kultur där din röst alltid blir hörd. Och allt vi får över ger vi tillbaka till samhället. Det är så vi gör skillnad på riktigt.

### **Om Online Customer Experience**


På vår enhet Online Customer Experience ansvarar vi för att analysera och optimera den digitala kundresan – från första besök till konvertering och lojalitet. Vi kombinerar datadrivna analyser med kundcentrerad research för att identifiera insikter, ta fram rekommendationer samt formulera hypoteser.


I teamet jobbar du nära en senior digital analytiker och en service designer. Tillsammans arbetar vi nära övriga e-handelsteam och andra affärsområden, med ett tydligt fokus på kund, affär och kontinuerlig optimering.

#### **Din roll**


I din roll som Digital Analytiker ansvarar du för att omvandla data till insikter som hjälper oss att förstå kundbeteenden, identifiera förbättringsområden och ta fram träffsäkra hypoteser för optimering och A/B-tester.


I rollen blir du en nyckelperson i vårt datadrivna arbetssätt. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt – från ad hoc-analyser till större djupdykningar som driver affärsnytta, kundvärde och utvecklingen av våra processer.  

  



#### **Vad du kommer göra hos oss:**


Som Digital Analytiker har du en viktig roll i att stärka Apotekets digitala kundupplevelse genom att:

* Driva större, djupgående analyser för att identifiera affärspotential och förbättringar.
* Genomföra ad hoc-analyser vid KPI-förändringar, skiftande kundbeteenden eller förfrågningar från andra team.
* Bidra till hypotesformulering, utvärdering och uppföljning inom A/B-testning och konverteringsoptimering.
* Skapa och utveckla dashboards samt visualiseringar i exempelvis LookerStudio, Power BI och Excel.
* Arbeta nära CRO, UX, produktutveckling och kommersiella team i tvärfunktionella samarbeten.
* Presentera insikter på ett tydligt och engagerande sätt till olika målgrupper/ intressenter.

### **Vem söker vi?**


För den här tjänsten söker vi dig som har ett analytiskt och kundcentrerat arbetssätt, och kan omvandla data till insikter som stöder prioritering, analyser och förbättringar i våra digitala kanaler. Du är skicklig på att visualisera och kommunicera komplexa data på ett enkelt sätt till olika målgrupper och bidrar till ett datadrivet, tvärfunktionellt arbete.

* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi, data/analys, teknik eller statistik, eller annan relevant utbildning.
* Minst 2-3 års erfarenhet av digital analys inom e-handel, verksamheter inom omnikanal och/eller annan datadriven digital verksamhet.
* Du har erfarenhet av att bidra med datadrivna hypoteser och insikter för A/B-testning och/eller har arbetat nära team som driver konverteringsoptimering.
* Förmåga att omsätta affärsfrågor, kvantitativa och kvalitativa data till relevanta KPI:er, insikter och rekommendationer.
* Erfarenhet av att presentera analyser och rekommendationer för olika målgrupper.
* Du är van vid att arbeta i analysverktyg så som Google Analytics, PowerBI, ContentSquare och Excel.

  

Det är meriterande om du har:

* Erfarenhet av appanalys.
* Erfarenhet av SQL eller BigQuery, eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av CRM/kundanalys eller kundundersökningar.
* Intresse eller erfarenhet av att använda AI som stöd i analysarbete.

### **Vi erbjuder...**

* Friskvårdsbidrag: 5000 kr per år.
* Personalrabatt: Förmånliga priser på många av våra produkter.
* Flexibla helgdagar: Möjlighet att byta arbetsfria helgdagar mot andra dagar på året.
* Förmånsportal (Benify): Erbjudanden inom bland annat kollektivtrafik, leasingbil, gym och hälsobehandlingar.
* Trygga försäkringar: Förstärkt föräldrapenning, tjänstepension (ITP) och kompletterande försäkringar.

#### **Om oss**


Apoteket grundades 1971 och ägs av svenska staten, vilket innebär att vi arbetar både ansvarsfullt och långsiktigt. Vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag handlar om att förbättra människors hälsa, läkemedelsanvändning och bidra till ökad patientsäkerhet. Med omkring 400 apotek och 3000 medarbetare över hela landet har vi nära samarbete med hälso- och sjukvården – alltid med omtanke om både människor och miljö.


Vårt mål är tydligt: Ett liv i hälsa, för alla.

#### **Nyfiken? Det räcker gott.**


Hör av dig om rollen fångar ditt intresse! Vi berättar gärna mer om tjänsten och vår verksamhet – så du får en tydligare bild och kan avgöra om det känns helt rätt. Vänta bara inte för länge, urval och intervju sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.


Skicka ditt CV tillsammans med svar på våra urvalsfrågor. Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev – frågorna är utformade för att hjälpa oss förstå mer om dina erfarenheter och kompetenser för matchning mot tjänst.


Vi använder tester för objektivt urval som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess. Provanställning tillämpas.

**Välkommen till Apoteket!**
----------------------------

title: Growth Marketing Specialist
description:
**About Mindler**


Mindler was founded in 2018 with a vision to create a world with better mental health. Since then, we have grown from a Swedish startup to become a pan-European mental healthtech organisation, helping people of all ages – from children to adults – across five markets.


We are on an exciting growth journey, building not just a workplace but a movement: making mental health accessible to more people, across borders and generations. Mindler is a place where you can help shape the future of mental healthcare – while growing together with us!

**The role**


As our Growth Marketing Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in accelerating Mindler’s international growth. You will own both traffic generation and web conversion, ensuring that ads and landing pages work together to create a seamless, data-driven user journey from first impression to booked appointment.


Reporting to the Head of Marketing and collaborating closely with Brand, Product, UX and Analytics, you will lead the development of a full-funnel approach that improves efficiency, lowers acquisition costs, and unlocks scalable multi-market growth.


This role blends strategic thinking with, even more importantly, hands-on execution. You will design, test, analyze, optimize, and continuously improve. It’s an opportunity for someone who wants to take real ownership of the performance engine at one of Europe’s most ambitious digital health companies.

**What you’ll be doing**

* Manage, optimize, and scale paid campaigns across Google Ads, Meta, TikTok, and additional performance channels, mainly in Sweden and the UK.
* Drive a holistic full-funnel strategy—from ad creative to landing page optimization.
* Connect platform spend with backend conversion data to determine true ROI and channel value.
* Improve conversion rates by improving ad creatives, Quality score and landing pages.
* Collaborate with Brand to iterate on ad creatives that maximize relevance and user engagement.
* Partner with Product, Tech, and UX to together implement tests, tracking solutions, and scalable experiment frameworks.
* Identify new channels, opportunities, and markets—and scale them efficiently.
* Build a structured, insights-driven experimentation culture.

**Who you are**


We are looking for a doer with at least four years of hands-on performance marketing experience, managing budgets and driving measurable growth across multiple markets. You thrive at the intersection of marketing, data, technology, and user psychology, balancing the analytical mindset of a “math person” with the intuition of a “psychology person” who understands user behavior, friction, and conversion dynamics. Structured, hypothesis-driven work comes naturally for you, and clear communication across teams allows you to bridge marketing, Tech/Dev, and Brand perspectives seamlessly.


We think you’ll be a good fit if you:

* Are hands-on, collaborative, and motivated by owning the full funnel, bringing traffic generation and website conversion together rather than treating them separately.
* Thrive in environments that demand managing multi-market campaigns.
* Use experiments and data to reduce CPA, improve landing pages, optimize Quality Scores, and drive scalable growth across markets.
* Combine operational execution with analytical rigor, applying insights consistently to deliver measurable results.
* Are energized by influencing high-traffic websites that help thousands of people access mental health support.

**What we can offer**


At Mindler, you will work with high-traffic, high-impact websites across multiple markets and have a direct influence on how thousands of people access mental health support.


You will have the freedom to innovate, test, and drive measurable improvements—supported by an established brand, strong cross-functional partners, and a mission-driven organization.


We offer a hybrid setup, flexibility, international collaboration, and a high-performing environment where creativity, experimentation, and growth are celebrated. Joining Mindler means contributing to a forward-thinking, values-driven movement shaping the future of digital mental healthcare on a global scale.

**Please note that we will review applications and get back to candidates regarding potential next steps in the process during the second to third week of January, after the holiday season.**

**We are looking forward to hearing from you!**

*–-*

*Mindler is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age.*

title: UX Designer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Du ska snabbt men med hög kvalitet ta designen genom hela UX processen fram till utveckling. Du behöver ha snabbt att sätta dig in i konkreta uppdrag, och leverera snabbt och träffsäkert. Ha hög förståelse för tekniska system och beroenden. Ha hög kunskap inom figma och moderna designssytem, ai och automation. Samt bevisat vara självgående och kunna hantera både verksamhet och kollegor i en organisation under förändring, högt tempo och relativt varierande designmognad.


Du behöver hög samarbetsförmåga, kommunikationsförmåga, kunna presentera och facilitera samt dokumentera och argumentera för designval. Minst 9 års erfarenhet.  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 17-12-2025

 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: UI/UX design
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Senior UI/UX design experience (UI-focused)Strong ability to design polished, high-quality interfaces for digital banking.
* Minimum 5 years of experienceProven track record designing for web, mobile, and app platforms.
* High proficiency in Figma


Able to create user flows, high-fidelity prototypes, and production-ready design assets.* Strong ownership & problem-solving mindset


Hands-on designer who takes responsibility and drives solutions forward in an agile environment.* User-centered design approach


Experience conducting and participating in user research, testing, and continuous iteration based on insights. **Meritorious**  

* Fluency in Swedish


English is required; Swedish is a clear advantage.* Experience working with Design Systems


Especially ensuring consistency and accessibility across multiple digital channels.* Background in financial services / digital banking


Particularly within private banking, wealth management, or similar regulated environments. **Application deadline:** 17-12-2025

 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Staff Product Designer, Merchant Team
description:
Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 27 countries today, 23 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

  





*Wolt not only offers great apps to customers and partners, but is also developing a broad range of technologies and solutions. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of minutes, in the customer’s own language.*




***So, why work at Wolt?***




*At Wolt, we’re about getting things done.*




*You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people. We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*




*The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.*




***Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion***




*We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.*




*Join us today to build Wolt together.*



**Job Description**

 We are looking for a
 **Staff Product Designer to join the Merchant Mission!** 
 The Merchant Group focuses on making Wolt an integral part of our Merchants’ daily lives in all the 25+ countries Wolt is active in. We provide our business partners with tools and automations that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use. Our products are built around self-service, which helps us keep trust at the core of our partner relationships.
   

  

  





 This will be someone who has mastered the craft of turning insights into beautifully designed products, who can inspire organisations through prototyping and storytelling to ensure their final work has maximum impact for the customer.
   

  

  





**📍** 
 This role can be based in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

  

  

  




**Our humble expectations**

**You’re a great fit for this role if you:**



* Drive strategic initiatives and shape broad direction of design
* Operate as a thought leader, communicating and advocating for design decisions across teams and with senior stakeholders, often influencing company-wide decisions
* Handle highly ambiguous and complex problems that require broader perspective, cross functional collaboration, and long term thinking
* Can take products from 0 to 1, from conception to delivery
* Design end to end, with focus on rapid prototyping and UI, crafting visually delightful experiences
* Thrive in a fast-paced organisation
* Are curious about new AI technologies and how we can use them in design



**What you’ll do:**



* **Listen carefully.** 
 The better you understand our users problems the better your solutions will be. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people and not just the loudest voice in the room.
* **Collaborate across teams.** 
 You’ll partner closely with product, engineering, and business folks to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges. You’ll provide the thought leadership to inspire and develop the right design direction. Together, you’ll solve problems and come up with solutions that delight our users.
* **Imagine the way forward.** 
 You’ll take full ownership of your work, and be responsible for every last detail, every step of the way.



**Who you are:**



* **Experience.** 
 You’ve been designing for
 **10+ years** 
 (app and desktop) for a consumer-focused tech company , so understand what it takes to create elegant, consumer-oriented experiences.
* **Mastery.** 
 You are a versatile t-shaped designer who uses a full range of skills—product design, interaction design, and visual design—to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the user.
* **You’re a strong communicator.** 
 You can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user.
* **You have a people-focused design mentality.** 
 Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether that’s hands-on user research or a quantitative A/B test.



  

  

  

  

  




**Next Steps**

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so feel free to apply as soon as you feel like hearing more about the position and potentially joining Wolt! Please kindly make sure to include your portfolio with your application.
   

  

  





 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie.

title: Webbredaktör/UX-skribent
description:
Vill du vara med och förbättra upplevelsen för våra kunder? Vi söker en webbredaktör/UX-skribent som utvecklar digitalt innehåll av hög kvalitet och som utgår ifrån kundernas behov och situation. Du skapar ett enkelt och guidande innehåll som hjälper våra kunder att lösa sin situation på ett snabbt och smidigt sätt. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som webbredaktör/UX-skribent får du möjlighet att vara med och driva Skatteverkets digitala utveckling framåt med fokus på kundens upplevelse. I arbetet ingår det att ta fram, kvalitetsgranska, publicera och underhålla samt optimera webbsidor och innehåll, bland annat utifrån webbanalys, användartester och tjänstedesign. Du kommer jobba med innehållsutveckling, tonalitet och innehållsstruktur. Det kan också innebära att delta i arbete med att utveckla vårt redaktionella arbetssätt samt kravställning för CMS-verktyg. Du arbetar även med verktyg som Matomo, Jira och Confluence.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta agilt i olika team där du skriver redaktionella texter tillsammans med de som har verksamhetskunskap, förenklar språket i vårt innehåll på webben och skapar innehåll i och för de tjänster vi erbjuder våra kunder. Arbetet innebär även tätt samarbete med många experter i organisationen. Som webbredaktör/UX-skribent får du möjlighet att ta ett stort eget ansvar och säkerställa att innehållet håller hög kvalitet avseende kundfokus, användbarhet och tillgänglighet.
   

  

 Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha balans mellan arbete och fritid. Du tillhör sektionen webb och intranät på enheten kundrelationer och kommunikation på Kund- och kommunikationsavdelningen med placering i Sundbyberg. På vår sektion är vi drygt 20 kollegor.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha en god samarbetsförmåga och lätt för att arbeta med personer med olika kompetenser
* ha en god kommunikativ och pedagogisk förmåga
* kunna arbeta självständigt och fatta egna beslut
* vara utvecklingsinriktad, nyfiken på nya arbetssätt och nya sätt att kommunicera


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant högskoleutbildning om 180 hp (120 p) inom kommunikation alternativt flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete där motsvarande kunskaper förvärvats exempelvis som webbredaktör/digital kommunikatör
* minst fyra års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet som webbredaktör/digital kommunikatör
* aktuell erfarenhet från arbete med stora externa webbplatser på statlig myndighet
* aktuell erfarenhet av arbete med verktygen Sitevision, Jira och Matomo


 Det är önskvärt att du har aktuell kunskap om och aktuell erfarenhet av arbete på Skatteverket sedan tidigare, digital tillgänglighet, UX copy, klarspråk, generativ AI inom webbkommunikation och agila arbetssätt.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/1046 | Kontakt: Lars Högström, hr-specialist 010-5749156, Jens Eriksson, sektionschef 010-5749612, | Facklig företrädare: Göran Sundwall, Saco 010-5748829, Viking Hermén, ST 010-5748013, Therese Sjödin, Seko 010-5741405, | Publicerat: 2025-12-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-22

title: Management Consultant – Service/UX/UI Designer (Stockholm)
description:
**ABOUT CAPGEMINI INVENT** 




 At frog, a part of Capgemini Invent, we believe difference drives change. As inventive transformation consultants, we blend our strategic, creative and scientific capabilities, collaborating closely with clients to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to drive transformation tailored to our client's challenges of today and tomorrow. Informed and validated by science and data. Superpowered by creativity and design. All underpinned by technology created with purpose.
 



  





**YOUR ROLE** 




 As our new Designer at frog, you have a couple of years of experience in designing new digital products and services using human-centered design practices. You understand the importance of user experience and can articulate how your design decisions support that. You are passionate about solving design challenges together with a team of other creatives, designers, and developers, and strive to deliver useful, user-friendly, and excellent work.
 



  





 In this role you will play a key role in:
 


* Partnering with leading organizations and multidisciplinary teams to solve real business challenges, develop strategies, design new business models, and implement solutions that drive measurable impact and long-term growth.
* Bringing bold ideas to life – from concept to execution by working at the intersection for creativity, strategy and technology.
* Being a part of a collaborative and vibrant community where design, data and business insight come together to reimagine customer experiences and drive lasting transformation.



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 



* A University degree in a relevant design or behavioral science discipline- such as Service Design, Digital Design, User Experience Design, Product Design, or Interaction Design- combined with hands-on experience.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* Minimum
 **4+ years of relevant full time working experience** 
 in a variety of organizations (start-up, corporate, agency/consultancy) and have had roles such as Service Designer, Art Director, UX Designer, or Product Designer.
* Strong portfolio showcasing digital design work, including wireframes, prototypes, and UI designs. You are proficient in design tools such as Figma, Sketch or Adobe XD and you have a solid understanding of user-centered design principles and accessibility best practices.
* Experience of generative AI design tools and working with motion, 3D design, front-end developers, design systems and component libraries is meriting



  





**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?** 



* **Learning & Development:** 
 A key focus of the Accelerate Programme is placed on your development and providing you with opportunities to learn a variety of skills in a range of environments. You will benefit from a suite of learning opportunities, including a dedicated WfO Academy curriculum from internal trainings to externally recognized professional accreditations.
* **Flexibility & Autonomy:** 
 You are free to make your role and your career what you want it to be. Proactivity and ambition flourish at Capgemini Invent. Our hybrid policy enables us to have one of the best scores for work-life balance on Glassdoor - giving you the chance to work from home, in the office, and sometimes abroad.
* **Global Connection:** 
 Network with our global community through a variety of our award-winning programs, such as InventX and Invent Director Excellence, as well as other various local employee networks to express your uniqueness and find like-minded people.



  





**NEED TO KNOW** 





 Start date and location
 




 You’ll join our Stockholm office in Fall 2026, ready to travel and work on projects at our client sites.
 



  






 Application process
 




 We review applications on an ongoing basis, so apply early to secure your spot. Please submit your CV in English along with your official high school and university transcripts. When applying through the system, upload these documents under “Cover Letter.” Since there is only one upload field for grades, we kindly ask you to merge your high school, bachelor’s, and master’s transcripts into a single document before uploading.
 



  





 As part of your application, also include either a link or a PDF of your portfolio showcasing recent work. Your portfolio should highlight your skills and experience relevant to the role, with clear examples of how you work, think, collaborate, and contribute to successful design outcomes. Please note that applications without a portfolio cannot be considered, as incomplete applications will not be reviewed.
 



  





*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required* 




  






 Next steps
 




 Our selection process includes several steps to ensure a fair and thorough evaluation:
 


* CV & grade screening
* Phone interview
* Video interview
* On-site case
* Final interview
* Offer



  





**ABOUT CAPGEMINI** 




 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry.
 



  





*#LI-DNI*

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re hiring
 **Senior Product Designers at Wolt Design** 
 across several exciting product areas:
   

  

* Consumer – You'll shape the core experience that millions of users rely on daily to discover, order, and enjoy their favorite meals and essentials—delivering delight at every tap.
* Merchant – You’ll build tools that help local businesses succeed on the Wolt platform, from order management to insights and growth levers—empowering merchants at scale.
* Courier – You’ll design experiences for the people who make Wolt run—our courier partners. From onboarding to daily logistics, your work will help make every delivery seamless.
* Central – You’ll create the systems, platforms, and tools that power Wolt behind the scenes—unlocking scale, speed, and smarter decisions across the company.


 Each team offers a chance to tackle unique design challenges with real-world impact.
   

  

 📍The roles are based in our tech hub in Berlin or Stockholm.
   

  

 You’re excited about this opportunity because:
   

  

* You care deeply about creating experiences that empower businesses and improve everyday life for merchants, couriers, and consumers.
* You lead with empathy, always designing with the user in mind.
* You thrive in complex, ambiguous problem spaces—and enjoy bringing structure, clarity, and direction.
* You hold a high bar for your craft, from concept to pixel—creating designs that are scalable, thoughtful, and beautiful.


 What you’ll be doing:
   

  

* Turn ambiguity into clarity. You’ll bring strong framing and product thinking to shape undefined problems into compelling design opportunities.
* Bring ideas to life beautifully. You’ll design intuitive interfaces and interactions that are both delightful and highly usable.
* Prototype to inspire. Through prototyping, storytelling, and systems thinking, you’ll align teams and build momentum—ensuring your work not only ships, but resonates.
* Own the full design stack. From strategy and exploration to refined visuals, you’ll lead high-impact initiatives from start to finish.


 Who you are:
   

  

 We’d love to work with you if:
   

  

* You have 6+ years of experience designing consumer, B2B, or SaaS products—building elegant, business-savvy solutions in complex environments.
* You’re a T-shaped designer with deep strengths in concepting, visual design and prototyping, able to drive high-quality outcomes in a collaborative, cross-functional team.
* You think in systems, not just screens—comfortable designing across diverse journeys and touchpoints.
* You’re a creative problem-solver, excited by ambiguity and energized by complex design challenges.
* You’re open to feedback—comfortable sharing early, learning fast, and evolving ideas with your team.
* You’re a strong communicator and natural storyteller, able to align stakeholders, build empathy, and drive design-led decisions.


 What’s next:
   

  

 As a next step, we’d love to see your
 **portfolio** 
 to better understand your design approach and impact. We’re especially interested in work that shows
 **strong visual craft** 
 ,
 **attention to detail** 
 , and
 **real results** 
 . One well-structured Figma file with your best, recent work is more valuable to us than multiple outdated case studies — products move fast, and relevance matters. If you have
 **high-fidelity prototypes** 
 or
 **motion work** 
 , even better. We're excited to see how you think and build. Please read this article for more info on how to build your folio!
   

  

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4gfa-m4SfM
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Design Manager, Merchant team
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for a sharp, execution-driven
 **Design Manager** 
 to join our
 **Merchant team** 
 at Wolt. This team builds self-serve, scalable tools for our merchants across 23+ countries—delivering new 0→1 products that empower partners to onboard, grow, and succeed independently. In today’s rapidly evolving product landscape, we’re not looking for someone to simply manage—we’re looking for someone to
 **lead from the front** 
 .
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who’s equally comfortable driving strategy and jumping into the work, who can inspire their team under pressure, and who sees ambiguity as an opportunity, not a blocker.
   

  

 At Wolt, we’ve evolved what design leadership looks like:
   

  

* From managing process to leading with conviction and momentum
* From coaching on craft to raising the bar through direction and example
* From aligning on frameworks to driving clarity and vision from first principles
* From interpreting strategy to shaping it alongside your product and engineering peers


 We’re looking for someone who brings
 **taste, speed, agency, and autonomy** 
 —someone who can make bold calls, build alignment quickly, and execute at a high level without waiting to be told.
   

  

 📍This role is based in our tech hub in Berlin or Stockholm.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Build and Lead: You’ll lead the design team within the Merchant area—building the strategy, shaping execution, and mentoring a high-performing team.
* Raise the Bar: Set and uphold a high bar for design quality, velocity, and craft. Not just in pixels—but in product thinking, clarity of storytelling, and interaction polish.
* Drive Strategy: Collaborate with group leads and product counterparts to define what we should build—not just how to build it.
* Move the Work: Guide the team through ambiguous 0→1 spaces. You’ll help cut through noise, unblock delivery, and bring strategic ideas to life through rapid execution.
* Coach and Elevate: Develop and grow designers through hands-on feedback, career support, and performance management. You’ll create an environment that pushes for both craft and pace.
* Leverage AI: Harness the power of AI to accelerate design exploration, enhance user insights, and increase execution velocity. You’ll empower the team to use AI as a creative and strategic partner—optimizing workflows, uncovering new opportunities, and driving smarter, data-informed decisions.
* Act with Urgency: You’ll work autonomously, drive change proactively, and prioritize impact over process. You understand that velocity is strategy.


**Our humble expectations**
* 3+ years of experience leading design teams in product-led organizations, ideally in SaaS, platform, or marketplace environments
* A sharp eye for detail and deep appreciation for high-quality, user-centered design
* A track record of building and shipping B2B or consumer tools across platforms (desktop + mobile)
* The ability to shape vision and drive execution—comfortable setting direction and rolling up your sleeves
* Proven leadership in high-ambiguity, fast-paced environments
* Strong storytelling, cross-functional influence, and stakeholder management skills
* Experience designing for or applying AI in product workflows
* A mindset of urgency, experimentation, and continuous improvement


**Next steps**
 As a next step, we’d love to
 **take a look at your portfolio** 
 to get a better sense of your experience and design leadership. We’re particularly interested in understanding how you approach challenges, shape direction, and bring ideas to life — both through your own craft and by guiding others. Work that shows how you think, collaborate, and evolve design over time is especially valuable to us. If you have any examples that reflect the final experience or outcomes, that’s always a great bonus.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Lead, MarTech
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced Product Lead to drive the vision, strategy, and execution of our Marketing Technology product area at Wolt. This role sits at the intersection of growth marketing, automation, and data, enabling our User Acquisition (UA) and CRM marketing teams to scale and automate efficiently, target intelligently and measure impact precisely across our paid marketing and consumer-facing CRM campaigns.
   

  

 As a Product Lead in MarTech, you will lead a cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists, and designers to build the tools, systems, and platforms that power paid marketing and CRM at scale. You’ll define and drive the product vision and roadmap for the MarTech team, ensuring alignment with business and growth goals. Your work will involve translating complex growth challenges into clear product bets that deliver measurable results across new user growth, engagement, retention, and customer lifetime value, while improving campaign efficiencies. You’ll also drive advancements in audience segmentation, targeting, attribution, campaign automation, and sophisticated marketing measurement systems that enable marketing teams to operate faster and smarter. In close collaboration with data and privacy teams, you’ll ensure that all marketing data, events, and measurement systems are accurate, privacy-compliant, and scalable.
   

  

 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* Extensive experience in product management, with a strong track record in growth, marketing tech, ads, or data platforms.
* Deep understanding of digital marketing, CRM, attribution, and experimentation - you know how marketers think and how tech can help them move faster.
* Experience leading cross-functional platform initiatives with multiple stakeholders and complex dependencies.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, you can rally teams and partners around a shared vision.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding, design sensitivity, and business savviness with the go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO".


 Next steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: E-Commerce & Growth Manager
description:
Ready to own the growth for a brand building a circular future?
 
  





 We create thoughtful everyday essentials—from plant-based MagSafe cases to stone paper notebooks—to prove that sustainability and profitable D2C growth can go hand-in-hand.
 



 We are looking for an
 **E-Commerce & Growth Manager** 
 to take full ownership of agood.com. Your mission is to transform our e-commerce into a smart, profitable engine that drives both sales and our meaningful purpose.
 



 If you are ready to combine
 **data, creativity, and entrepreneurial execution** 
 to deliver measurable growth
 *without* 
 compromising our values, this is your opportunity.
   




 The role at a glance: your impact
   


 You will be the core driver of our D2C machine. Your day will focus on optimizing, testing, and scaling initiatives that strengthen both profitability and customer loyalty.
 



  




* **Ownership:** 
 Take full responsibility for agood.com (Shopify+)—from UX/CRO to product setup and landing page optimization.



  




* **Profitable Growth:** 
 Plan and execute scalable, profitable paid campaigns (Meta, TikTok, Google) with a relentless focus on positive ROI. We only scale what’s smart.



  




* **Strategic Seat:** 
 Work directly with the CEO and Brand Director to set the long-term D2C strategy and build a 12-month growth roadmap.


 What you'll be doing
   

 1. E-Commerce & Conversion
 * Drive continuous testing to increase Conversion Rate (CRO), AOV, and retention.
* Lead external partners (ads, tech) while driving priorities and decisions in-house.
* Track and optimize key KPIs: ROAS, CPA, profit margin, and repeat rate.


 2. Digital growth, collaborations & activations (Expanded Focus)
 * Manage CRM/Automation (Klaviyo) and turn weekly data insights into concrete actions.
* **Actively seek out new, strategic collaborations** 
 (collabs) that expand our reach and brand awareness.
* Assist with
 **simple PR tasks** 
 (pitching product news) and
 **coordinating smaller events** 
 that foster community and brand presence.
* Ensure all growth activities are profitable and perfectly aligned with our brand identity.


 3. Content & Creators
 * Plan and manage content calendars for TikTok, Instagram, and the website.
* Identify and partner with ambassadors and creators who genuinely share our values.
* Coordinate content production that reflects our circular, design-driven DNA.


 Who we are looking for
   

* You have
 **2–5 years of experience** 
 in e-commerce, performance marketing, or digital growth, ideally from a D2C brand.
* Proven ability to deliver measurable, profitable growth—even with limited budgets.
* Skilled in
 **Shopify, Meta Ads, Google Analytics, and CRM** 
 (Klaviyo or similar).
* You have an
 **entrepreneurial drive** 
 : You create momentum and don't wait for direction.
* A strong blend of creative and analytical thinking—you understand both brand and data.
* Fluent in both
 **English and Swedish** 
 (written and verbal).
* Passionate about sustainability, design, and building something meaningful.


 What we offer
   

* **Real Ownership:** 
 Full mandate to drive our e-commerce and work directly with the CEO and Brand Director.
* **Meaningful Mission:** 
 A unique opportunity to prove that profitability and sustainability are complementary.
* **Growth and Team:** 
 Join a small, ambitious, international team with short decision paths.
* **Stockholm/Hybrid:** 
 Flexible working options based out of our Stockholm office.
* **Long-Term Upside:** 
 Performance-linked incentives tied to the company’s success.



  





**Ready to take ownership of a brand that’s making a difference?**

title: Junior Mobile iOS Engineer - Consumer Mobile Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world.  Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Wolt is looking for iOS Engineers to expand our Consumer Mobile Platform team. The team is part of the Consumer Product group and is responsible for enabling the delivery of the consumer mobile apps that millions of people in over 20 countries around the world see when ordering food and other products.
   

  

 Our client platform teams have a clear mission:
   

  

**“Enable delivery and ownership of Wolt-grade Consumer Client Applications through engineering excellence and domain expertise.”**

 As part of the team, and to fulfil our mission, you will focus on many different areas:
   

  

* Building the foundation of our top-rated consumer facing applications

* Aligning with multiple stakeholders

* If you like to communicate with many stakeholders, think about the long-term health and quality of customer experience and technical solutions, find ways to make other engineers’ lives easier and raise the bar of engineering excellence, this is the team for you!


 This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki or Berlin. Read more about our remote setup here. 🌍
   

  

 Feel free to check the Wolt Tech Blog for more read about our culture & technology here.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Experienced in iOS development
* Understanding of the iOS ecosystem and platform
* A strong interest in building a maintainable and extensible iOS platform
* End-to-end system design understanding
* Familiar with CI/CD pipelines
* Strong communication skills
* Stakeholder management experience
* Optional, but great to have: Experience/interest in mobile observability
* Have an eye for great user experience


 Next Steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so apply as soon as you realize you’d love to join us!

title: Product Lead, Payments
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the Payments Group, Core Payments Team.
   

  

 The Payments group builds and scales the infrastructure that powers every transaction on Wolt. This includes integrating with global payment providers, ensuring reliable and cost-efficient processing across countries, and driving innovations like digital wallets, installment payments, and localized methods. The Core Payments Team owns the foundations of this stack, making sure that Wolt’s payments platform is secure, scalable, and ready for the future.
   

  

 The Product Lead for the Core Payments Team connects with country teams to understand payment cultures in local markets, facilitates business and technical discussions with providers like Stripe, and aligns with product, finance, and data teams on company-wide needs.
   

  

 As a Product Lead, you will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, analysts, and product peers in a high visibility role. You will be responsible for defining the roadmap and setting the vision for our payments infrastructure. This involves leading multiple projects and cross-team product initiatives across the entire product lifecycle—partnering with operations, finance, and engineering stakeholders, while always keeping the end-user and business impact in focus.
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin, or Stockholm
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Proven experience as a Product Lead in fintech, payments, or other B2B platform products. You know how to build robust, scalable financial systems.
* Track record of leading products from concept to launch—owning the vision, setting the strategy, shaping the roadmap, and delivering real results.
* Skilled at working with cross-functional teams across product, engineering, data, and business—keeping people aligned and momentum strong.
* High ownership mindset. Comfortable getting hands-on when needed, while also pushing complex initiatives beyond your immediate scope.
* Strong blend of data fluency, technical depth, design intuition, and business judgment—grounded in a humble, entrepreneurial mindset.
* Confident in high-visibility roles. Clear communicator who knows how to keep stakeholders aligned, even in messy or high-pressure situations


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Owner
description:
**Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights, TUI, etc.**
**Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 3000 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Greece, India, Canada, Poland and Uruguay.**
 The Role
   

  

 Initially you will be working alongside a Senior Product Owner to ensure development targets are met around the given domain. You will join her/his daily work with the development teams, coordinating Business Owners, Product Managers, Project Managers, CX, UX, Developers as well as other stakeholders.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Being part of the long term product/domain plan and requirement assessment process.
* Ensuring knowledge sharing throughout the organization and that stakeholders are updated continuously with the latest status.
* Providing post-release and day-to-day support by collecting, filtering, organizing, prioritizing and following up bug reports and questions.
* Identifying problems/opportunities within your domain and bringing them to life.


**Team Descriptions**
**Air Content**
 The mission of Air Content is to ensure that Etraveli Group offers the widest array of relevant air content in the world, facilitating the customer's booking process and generating value to our customers and partners. The team interacts with stakeholders across all business domains (e.g. Sales, Operations, Commercial), directly with our partners (e.g. Metas, Booking.com) and with development teams across business domains (e.g. Customer Facing, Ancillaries, Post Booking). Within 2024 special focus will be placed on ensuring we meet ours and Bcom’s goals on increasing sales originating from Bcom direct traffic.
   

  

**Ancillary**
 The mission of the Ancillary teams is to ensure that Etraveli Group have relevant ancillary offering to enhance the travel experience both pre, during and post travel and by that generating value to our customers and partners.
   

  

 The teams interacts with stakeholders across all business domains (e.g. Sales, Customer Service, Commercial), directly with our partners (e.g. Metas, Booking.com) and with other development teams across business domains (e.g. Foundation, Post Booking Automation, Air Content).
   

  

**Payments**
 The mission of the Payment teams is to offer frictionless payments both for customers and carriers, as well as protecting the company from fraudulent payment attempts. Payment domain consists of 4 development teams, located in Athens, Gothenburg and Montevideo. Customer Payments team (Athens, Montevideo) handling the onboarding of global and localised payment methods and providers. Risk management team (Athens) that is responsible for the company’s fraud management system and intelligence. And Supplier Payments team (Gothenburg) in charge of the expansion of the payment portfolio to facilitate airline payments and the development of features to increase automation on product steering processes.
   

  

**Post Booking Automation**
 The vision of the Post Booking Automation teams is to manage changes and cancellations on customer bookings. We focus on creating automation, self-service solutions and agent tools that empower both our customers and our partners. As a Product Owner in this domain, you will play a key role in shaping and delivering seamless experiences that ensure quick, efficient and reliable handling of customer requests. Your work will directly impact how travelers and agents manage bookings.
   

  

**Foundation**
 The mission of the Foundation teams is to help our customers and agents in the best way across all processes and interfaces. The domain includes development teams managing the interfaces towards customers, including App and Web. It also includes the agent-facing platforms we use as well as teams focusing on ensuring the reconciliation and accounting is done accurately for the different processes leading to a financial transaction. As a Product Owner you take part in deciding on how we should tackle this in the best way together with developers, UX personnel and stakeholders in both Sweden, Greece and India.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have the ability to break down a complex concept/process into simpler parts and present it to someone with less insights.
* You are used to working with people and have excellent communication skills (verbal and written communication), being able to tailor your language to the audience you refer to.
* You thrive when taking on new responsibilities and feel comfortable making decisions.
* Ability to deliver a data driven approach with a customer-first mindset.


**Meritorious**
* Some technical knowledge of how GDS and/or LCC booking processes work.
* Experience of working in internal ETG tools like Edvin, Looker etc.
* Experience of working in documentation programs such as Atlassian or Figma.
* Experience of the Agile world such as Scrum and/or Kanban.
* Previous experience working with AI technologies is considered an asset.


**Benefits**
 Working at Etraveli Group means working at a fast-growing company with high ambitions in becoming the number one Online travel agency worldwide. The culture at the company embraces complexity and we like to keep the entrepreneurial spirit even as we grow into being a larger company. With us you can enjoy:
   

  

* A flexible working environment. We work on a hybrid-model where you can choose to work two days from home and you will have two weeks per year that you can choose to work from a remote location
* Modern office in the heart of the city – A bright and central location with great access to public transport, lunch spots, and parks just around the corner.
* Healthcare allowance – Each employee receives a maximum allowable amount each year according to the Swedish Tax Agency to spend on health-promoting activities such as a gym card, massage etc.
* Pension and health insurance – Through partners we offer a comprehensive pension and health insurance so that you can get help quickly in case of an accident.
* Daily breakfast – To kick the day off just right, breakfast is available at the office every morning.


***As part of this recruitment process, we will be conducting background checks. You will be able to read more information and give your consent to this process in the application form.***
