title: Business Data Analyst
description:
We’re looking for a Business Data Analyst to join us at Telia.
   

  

**Are you a data enthusiast with a passion for uncovering hidden insights? Do you thrive in solving complex problems and want to make an impact? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!**
 My name is Sanchita Sinha, Head of Data & Analytics Delivery for Network at Telia Company and today we're looking for a talented
 **Data Analyst** 
 to join our
 **Common Products Analytics** 
 team. Your analytical skills will play a vital role in driving Telia products streams with data driven insights.
   

  

 Telia Company are committed to delivering exceptional telecommunications services. Our team collaborates closely with all business units to align technology investments with corporate objectives, fostering innovation, operational excellence, and resilience. We prioritize scalable, secure, and sustainable services and solutions that optimize infrastructure, leverage data intelligence, and improve customer experience, ensuring our technological capabilities stay ahead in a dynamic telecom landscape.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As a Data Analyst in the Common Products Analytics team, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to identify discrepancies, develop effective solutions, and support strategic decision-making. Your insights will directly contribute to the product goals and success of our organization across our Nordic and Baltic business.
   

  

 You will be working in a
 **cross-functional** 
 team tightly integrated with our
 **Business Stakeholders** 
 . Collaborate with them and IT to understand the different processes and how different systems interact with each other to provide services to our customers. Analyze
 **large datasets** 
 to
 **identify trends** 
 , patterns, and anomalies related to the use case to generate valuable insights. Collaborate with stakeholders to focus on defined vision and resolve business problems. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to support data driven decisions. Support the implementation of data-driven strategies to enhance business practices.
   

  

**What will help you thrive in this role:**
 You are
 **independent** 
 with a
 **strong drive** 
 , yet a
 **team player** 
 who appreciates an inclusive team environment. You have a proven track record in
 **data analysis** 
 , where your unique blend of analytical, technical, and business skills has created value. Specifically, you have proven experience as a Data Analyst with success stories to share. Your
 **analytical** 
**skills** 
 enable you to interpret complex data sets and work with various databases while effectively managing data from multiple sources. You are proficient in data analysis tools and software such as
 **SQL** 
 and
 **Python** 
 and have experience with data visualization tools like
 **Qlik Sense** 
 ,
 **Tableau** 
 or
 **Power BI** 
 . Your curious and proactive mindset drives you to raise and test hypotheses to uncover insights. You have excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and strong communication and collaboration abilities. You can initiate, drive, and adapt to change in a dynamic environment.
   

  

**Join us to shape smarter living for people, businesses, and the planet**
 At Telia, we’re a team of 15 000 colleagues across the Nordics and Baltics, passionate about technology and connectivity. As a
 **Leading Telecommunications Operator** 
 &
 **Climate Leader** 
 , we drive change with large-scale, impactful projects while building a sustainable, inclusive world.
   

  

 Here, you can
 **grow your skills, lead meaningful projects, and thrive in a supportive, diverse environment.** 
 Whether you’re taking your first step or your next, Telia is a place to grow, belong, and make a real impact.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results.
   

  

 For applicants in Lithuania: The range of monthly salary for this position is from 3043 (Eur) gross to 4565 (Eur) gross.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 Please note that we might close the position earlier if we find the right candidate, so don’t wait too long to apply!
   

  

 Background and reference checks will be part of the process.
   

  

 Want to know more about this role? Please reach out at
 **sanchita.sinha@teliacompany.com**
**Equal opportunities**
 At Telia, we recognize talent by
 **professional skills and growth potential.** 
 We champion diversity, ensuring every individual’s needs are met, regardless of disability, gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation, or social status. Together, we’re dedicated to fostering an inclusive work environment where
 **your uniqueness is our strength.**
**Join us and let’s make better happen - together!**

title: SEB International Trainee Programme 2026-27: Non-Financial Risk Manager | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you ready to make your mark on the finance industry and positively shape the world? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while sustainability and digitalization influence our long-term strategy.
   

  

 With the International Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank** 
 .
   

  

 Your Trainee position and your team
   

  

**Ready to innovate while identifying and mitigating risk for the bank and its customers?** 
 Join SEB’s Group Technology CIO office, within the Risk Management area.
   

  

**As a Non-Financial Risk Manager, You Will**
* Support and advise the business and management as set out in the risk management process – ensuring that non-financial risks are mitigated and proactively avoiding events that can lead to loss
* Ensure trustworthiness for SEB’s customers and the financial market
* Be responsible for governing, coordinating, and supporting the business line in the risk management process
* Collaborate with Risk Managers end-to-end throughout the whole business process and reach out to subject matter experts such as product or process experts
* Be responsible for supporting the organization with the knowledge to work in a structured way to identify risks, that is to say how to use the tools provided by the second line of defense
* Structure efficient workshops for large and small groups


 Simultaneously by working in the role you are being recruited to,
 **you will participate in SEB's International Trainee Programme for nine months** 
 . It will give you the opportunity to develop an extensive network within the bank, gain a deep understanding of the financial industry and be professionally and personally challenged.
   

  

 As part of the programme, you can expect to: contribute to meaningful projects, work on communication and leadership skills, do rotations in other teams across the bank, participate in a business challenge and do an international internship at another SEB site in the world.
   

  

 Key traits to thrive in this role and programme
   

  

 We’re looking for young talents who are curious, motivated, and ready to question the status quo.
   

  

**To thrive in this role and in the International Trainee programme, we believe you have:**
* Graduated within the past two years, or will graduate before the programme starts on 1st September 2026 – from a relevant academic degree
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to take ownership
* Excellent communication skills and to be able to work in English


**We Also Believe You**
* Are a team player with a positive attitude, being good at building relationships and inducing trust with stakeholders at all levels
* Are independent and take initiative – and able to multi-task and getting things done
* Are solution-oriented, proactive and forward-thinking


 Previous experience (part-time work, life abroad etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A nine-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the International Trainee and Tech Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* International exposure with opportunities to work at SEB offices in other countries
* A caring, supportive and respectful culture
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the International Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The International Trainee programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please note that the Alva Labs assessments will be connected to the email you applied with.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the International Trainee Programme here: International Trainee Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Supply Chain Planner
description:
*Karo Healthcare, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.*




 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a Supply Chain Planner for our office in Stockholm.
   




****What's in it for you?****

 At Karo, you'll step into a fast-moving, international environment where
 **you take ownership, grow quickly, and see your impact play out across multiple markets** 
 . Expect
 **broad exposure** 
 ,
 **hands-on responsibility** 
 , and the chance to shape processes as we scale. This is an opportunity to build your expertise in a team that values initiative, continuous improvement, and cross-functional collaboration.
   




****What you'll be doing****

 In this role, you'll ensure product availability across our global network—balancing service, cost, and quality in a fast-paced, FMCG-like environment. You will own key planning KPIs while supporting our commercial teams with sharp, reliable execution.
   





 You will:
 


* Take responsibility for core KPIs:
+ Service Levels (product availability at warehouse)
+ Inventory (Days on Hand)
+ Planning Parameters (Lead Time, MOQ, OTIF, Safety Stock)
+ Excess management / expiry dates management
+ OOS reporting and mitigation planning

* Manage daily operational planning tasks to meet targets, uphold quality standards, and follow agreed processes
* Lead and contribute to supplier meetings to strengthen collaboration and improve performance
* Identify and escalate supply risks early, driving proactive mitigation plans across functions
* Contribute to continuous improvement within Planning & Logistics, helping elevate supply chain excellence
* Manage system settings to optimize inventory levels and service performance
* Support the development of the Planning and Logistics roadmap


**Requirements**
* Preferably an academic degree or equivalent in Supply Chain, Operations, Logistics, or Engineering
* Minimum 3-5 years' experience in supply planning within a complex environment—pharmaceutical or FMCG is highly relevant
* Experience working with Microsoft Office, ERP systems, and planning tools (IFS, Visma, So99+ are strong advantages)
* Excellent communication skills and strong stakeholder management abilities
* Fluent spoken and written English


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage


* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule and life work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



  
 



   
 



*Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: Presales Team Lead
description:
**Role:** 
 Presales Lead – SAP Solutions (S/4HANA & Manufacturing Focus)
 



**Experience (Years):** 
 15+ years
 



**Language requirement:** 
 Swedish & English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




  





 We are seeking a dynamic Presales Lead with 15+ years of experience to drive presales and solutioning activities for SAP-focused engagements, with a particular emphasis on S/4HANA business solutioning in the Manufacturing domain. The ideal candidate will independently manage RFP/RFI responses, craft compelling proposals, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-value SAP solutions that address client business needs.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**SAP S/4HANA Solutioning & Presales** 




  




* Lead the creation of business-focused SAP S/4HANA solutions tailored to client requirements, especially for Manufacturing industry clients.
* Respond to RFPs/RFIs with value-driven proposals, focusing on SAP S/4HANA transformation programs, assessments, and cloud solutions.
* Articulate business value and competitive differentiation of SAP S/4HANA solutions, especially in early sales cycle stages.
* Support acquisition of new customer logos and contribute to overall portfolio growth strategy.



  





  





**Manufacturing Domain Expertise** 




  




* Demonstrate deep understanding of manufacturing business processes, industry trends, and challenges.
* Position SAP S/4HANA as a strategic enabler for digital transformation in manufacturing, including automation, supply chain optimization, and production planning.



  





**Functional SAP S/4HANA Modules (Expertise in at least a few of these areas)** 




  




* SAP S/4HANA Finance (FI/CO)
* SAP S/4HANA Sales & Distribution (SD)
* SAP S/4HANA Materials Management (MM)
* SAP S/4HANA Production Planning (PP)
* SAP S/4HANA Plant Maintenance (PM)
* SAP S/4HANA Quality Management (QM)
* SAP S/4HANA Supply Chain (SCM)
* SAP S/4HANA Manufacturing (Discrete & Process)
* SAP S/4HANA Procurement
* SAP S/4HANA Analytics & Reporting



  





**Bid Management** 




  




* Own the end-to-end bid process, including RFP/RFI analysis, response strategy, proposal writing, pricing coordination, and submission timelines.
* Ensure compliance with internal bid governance processes and client requirements.



  





**Stakeholder Coordination** 




  




* Collaborate with sales, delivery, finance, and legal teams to gather inputs and finalize proposals.
* Engage with clients through discussions, presentations, and workshops to support sales and solutioning efforts.



  





**Knowledge Management** 




  




* Maintain a repository of reusable assets, case studies, and templates to accelerate future bids.



  





**Governance & Delivery Support** 




  




* Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction across SAP programs and engagements.
* Provide updates to client senior management and participate in steering committees as needed.



  





**Required Qualifications & Experience** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Business, Computer Science, or related field; MBA preferred.
* 10+ years of experience in presales, solutioning, or bid management roles, with a strong focus on SAP solutions (especially S/4HANA).
* Proven track record of independently managing large and complex RFP/RFI responses for SAP projects.
* Strong understanding of SAP business processes, digital transformation, and cloud/infrastructure domains.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficiency in tools like MS Office, SharePoint, and bid management platforms.



  





**Preferred Attributes** 




  




* Experience working with global clients in sectors such as Manufacturing, Telecom, BFSI, or Retail.
* Exposure to AI-led platforms, automation, and hybrid cloud solutions.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple bids simultaneously.
* Willingness to travel for client workshops or solution presentations.
* Experience in global delivery models and multicultural environments.



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **aswini.ranganathan@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Sales Manager B2B at Wolt
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 1000 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Sales Manager** 
 at Wolt, you’ll be at the forefront of our growth and we want you to be our deal-closer towards restaurants, retailers, and other local businesses. You’ll identify potential partners, pitch the value of Wolt, and work closely with merchants to onboard them successfully onto our platform.
   

  

 With solid product knowledge, you will clearly communicate how Wolt can strengthen businesses and provide tailored solutions to meet customer needs. In addition, you will work closely with other internal departments to ensure a smooth transition from sales to implementation and support.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for a driven and experienced sales professional who is eager to take their career to the next level through hands-on sales success. At Wolt, ambition and impact matter most – and we believe your personality, track record, and ability to build strong relationships will define your success.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who has already demonstrated strong results in B2B sales and is excited to keep pushing for growth: building pipelines, closing deals, and exceeding targets.
   

  

**What you'll be doing:**
* Prospect, negotiate, and close partnerships with key merchants across multiple verticals (restaurants, retail, grocery.
* Drive and lead complex sales cycles with senior decision-makers
* Shape sales strategies and identify new growth opportunities in the market
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure smooth partner onboarding and long-term success
* Mentor and support junior sales colleagues by sharing best practices and expertise


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* 2–4 years of B2B sales experience, ideally in restaurant, retail, or related industries
* Proven track record in closing complex deals and achieving ambitious sales targets
* Excellent command of Swedish and English. Fluency in another language is a strong plus
* Willingness to travel extensively across Sweden, including overnight stays (up to 75% of working time)
* A driver’s license is not required, but considered a strong plus


 We will place great emphasis on your personal qualities – particularly your ability to combine drive and ambition with collaboration and leadership.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Wolt, you get the best of both worlds: the fast pace and opportunity of a scale-up combined with the stability and backing of a well-established company.
   

  

* A chance to shape the future of Wolt’s sales strategy in Sweden.
* A role where your ideas can make a direct impact.
* A competitive salary package and benefits.
* Ongoing coaching, clear goals, and opportunities to grow into broader leadership roles.


 Next steps
   

  

 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Information Security GRC Analyst
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join our dynamic team at Odevo as a passionate Information Security GRC Analyst and play a pivotal role in fortifying our information security landscape! We are on the lookout for a talented individual who is eager to contribute to Odevo’s success. In this exciting position, you'll have the opportunity to design and lead our supplier due diligence program, craft engaging security awareness training, and orchestrate realistic phishing simulations. You'll also be instrumental in shaping a robust information security governance framework, and supporting the development and upkeep of our disaster recovery (DR) plans. Additionally, you'll ensure our sub-businesses are aligned with our security standards, making a significant impact on our overall compliance. If you're ready to take on a challenge and make a true difference, we want to hear from you
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Supplier Due Diligence Program:
* Develop and implement a risk-based supplier due diligence program.
* Assess supplier security practices and ensure compliance with company standards.
* Security Awareness Training:
* Implement and manage security awareness training programs.
* Create and send phishing simulation emails to test employee awareness.
* Analyze results and produce metrics to identify areas for improvement.
* Information Security Policies:
* Create and manage information security policies to ensure compliance and best practices.
* Disaster Recovery (DR) Plans:
* Support the creation and maintenance of disaster recovery plans.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure DR plans are comprehensive and effective.
* Track Compliance to Security Initiatives:
* Work with IT representatives to monitor compliance with Odevo baselines for security implementations in the cloud and across security tooling.
* Report on compliance to management


**Who You Are**
 You possess strong communication skills, enabling you to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your detail-oriented nature and proactive approach to problem-solving and solution design make you adept at working with security GRC challenges, translating them into clear and actionable security insights. You are fluent in English and it is an added bonus if you know additional languages such as Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, German, Swedish or Finnish.
   

  

**Experience**
* 2+ years of proven experience in a similar role.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Proven experience in information security assurance, with a focus on supplier due diligence and security awareness training.
* Strong understanding of information security policies and best practices.
* Experience in conducting phishing simulations and analysing results.
* Some understanding of security certifications, frameworks and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIST Cyber Framework, NIS2, DORA).


**Desired Experience (but Not Required)**
* Technical knowledge of security principles, concepts, and technologies.
* Previous experience in aligning to security certifications and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIS2, DORA)
* Familiarity with disaster recovery planning and implementation.
* Degree in Risk Management, Information Security or a related field.
* Relevant certifications in Information Security GRC or related fields.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #msl

title: Network Security Engineer
description:
Bankgirot söker nu en Network Security Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som Network Security Engineer arbetar du operativt med att övervaka, konfigurera och vidareutveckla nätverkssäkerhetslösningar – exempelvis brandväggar, IDS/IPS, NDR och segmentering. Du säkerställer att vår nätverkstrafik och våra säkerhetslösningar håller högsta möjliga nivå och följer både interna säkerhetsprinciper och externa regulatoriska krav. Rollen kräver nära samarbete med tech lead, drift, utveckling och säkerhetsfunktioner och innebär både proaktivt och reaktivt arbete – från implementation och konfiguration till trafik- och händelseanalys, incidenthantering och dokumentation.
   

  

 Du blir en viktig del i vår satsning på Zero Trust och bidrar till att skapa en robust och framtidssäker nätverksarkitektur. Arbetet sker i en dynamisk och komplex IT-miljö där du får stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka hur våra tekniska lösningar utvecklas.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du har ett genuint intresse för cybersäkerhet och trivs i komplexa IT-miljöer där tillgänglighet, säkerhet och kvalitet är centrala delar. Med en lösningsorienterad och strukturerad approach drivs du av att verka i en dynamisk organisation i förändring.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta operativt med nätverkssäkerhet i tekniskt avancerade miljöer. Du har arbetat med Next Generation Firewalls (NGFW), IDS/IPS, NDR och VPN, och har god förståelse för nätverkstopologi, segmentering och gärna NSX. Du har också god kunskap om TCP/IP, nätverksanomalier och intrångsdetektering samt erfarenhet av HSM, PKI och hantering av certifikat i nätverkssammanhang. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med Zero Trust-arkitektur eller har erfarenhet av SOC och SIEM-verktyg.
   

  

 Mer information och ansökan
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279.
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: IT-specialist Arbetsplats
description:
*Till vårt huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm söker vi nu en IT-specialist för Digital Arbetsplats.*
 Nu söker vi dig som har vana att planera, samordna och följa upp tekniknära leveranser – gärna i samarbete med outsourcingpartner – inom områden som Intune, SCCM och andra delar av en Modern Workplace-miljö och som vill bidra till ett meningsfullt samhällsuppdrag - där service, omtanke om människa och miljö alltid står i fokus.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som IT-specialist blir du en del av Digital Arbetsplats på enheten Digital Service & Drift, där vårt uppdrag är att se till att Systembolaget har en driftstabil, säker och pålitlig digital miljö samt en modern Digital Arbetsplats. Du kommer att arbeta i ett engagerat team med 6 personer och rapporterar direkt till Gruppchef för Digital Arbetsplats. Du fungerar som den tekniska länken mellan våra förvaltningar, verksamheten och leverantörer.
   

  

**I Din Roll Som IT-specialist Kommer Du Att**
* Delta i moderniseringen av vår klientplattform, inklusive övergången mot molnbaserad hantering, automatisering och införande av nya funktioner.
* Planera, samordna och följa upp den tekniknära leveransen från vår outsourcingpartner inom Intune, SCCM och Modern Workplace.
* Bidra till beslut inom klienthantering, säkerhet och användarupplevelse genom att tillföra teknisk kompetens och omvärldsbevakning.
* Säkra att behörigheter och åtkomster hanteras korrekt, enligt gällande säkerhetspolicy och dataskyddskrav.


**Om dig**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* 3–5 års erfarenhet av en liknande roll inom Modern Workplace.
* God teknisk erfarenhet av verktyg som Intune, SCCM och relaterade Modern Workplace-lösningar.
* Teknisk kompetens inom hantering och administration av Windows, iOS och Android.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt agila utvecklingsmetoder samt processorienterat, gärna enligt ITIL.
* Erfarenhet av dataskyddsarbete och IT-säkerhetsarbete kopplat till klient- och enhetshantering.


 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du som person har ett flexibelt förhållningsätt, en nyfiken inställning till att lära nytt samt har ett intresse av de möjligheter som moderna digitala verktyg skapar. Du är van vid tvärfunktionellt samarbete, bygger goda relationer och möter andramed ett öppet förhållningssätt.  Du är van att leda ditt eget arbete och leverans.
   

  

 I urvalet kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Hos oss är det enkelt att vara engagerad**
 Genom vår ansvarsfulla försäljning vill vi bidra till bättre folkhälsa och en hållbar utveckling för både människor och miljö. Systembolaget bygger på människor – våra kunder, våra kollegor och vårt gemensamma uppdrag. Hos oss får du möjlighet att göra skillnad, utvecklas, påverka och lyckas tillsammans med andra.
   

  

 Systembolaget utvecklas ständigt och det kommer du också att göra. För oss är det viktigt att vi som jobbar här mår bra och att vi skapar balans mellan arbete, familj och fritid. Vi tror starkt på långsiktighet både ur ett socialt och hållbart perspektiv. Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss.
   

  

**Känns rollen rätt för dig?**
 Kul! Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV så snart som möjligt. För att kunna göra en rättvis och likvärdig bedömning av dig som sökande använder vi oss av urvalsfrågor. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du få svara på ett antal frågor om din kompetens och erfarenhet för rollen. Vi kommer att göra urval och intervjuer löpande. Webbaserade tester, case och bakgrundskontroll kommer att vara en del i slutfasen av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och inleds med 6 månaders provanställning. Vårt mål är att spegla samhället och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja mångfald och säkerställa likabehandling. Vi välkomnar medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser för att skapa en inkluderande arbetsplats där alla har möjlighet att utvecklas och bidra. Som anställd hos oss på Systembolaget får du ta del av konkurrenskraftiga förmåner såsom, lunch- och friskvårdsbidrag, bra pensions- och semestervillkor.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Välkommen att kontakta Daniel Wåg, Enhetschef- daniel.wag@systembolaget.se.
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
   

  

 Systembolaget finns till för alla i Sverige för att bidra till bättre folkhälsa genom att begränsa alkoholens skador. Vi bidrar med kunskap och oberoende rådgivning om mat och dryck och hur alkohol påverkar hälsan. På så vis vill vi inspirera till medvetna dryckesval och ett hälsosammare förhållningssätt till alkohol där varken människor eller miljön tar skada. Läs mer om oss på omsystembolaget.se.

title: BIT - Head of Integrations
description:
**Who We Are**
 We’re bold thinkers and kind teammates, growing fast but staying grounded. Our Nordic roots and global outlook shape a culture of friendliness, creativity, and collaboration, all powered by openness and shared wins. We care deeply about doing the right thing - and doing it together. We aim to improve the flow of goods, time, and energy - and we know we can’t shape the future by clinging to the past. So, we keep evolving together.
   

  

**What We Do**
 RELEX Solutions delivers a unified supply chain planning platform for retailers and manufacturers, enabled by proven AI technology. We help companies optimize demand forecasting, replenishment, merchandising, pricing and promotions, supply chain operations, and production planning across the end-to-end value chain.
   

  

 With a global team of over 2,000 professionals, we work side-by-side with our customers to solve real problems with lasting impact. Companies trust RELEX to increase product availability, boost sales, deliver actionable insights, improve sustainability, and drive profitable growth. Join us and make an impact on the world and your career!
   

  

 In response to our fast growth and market expansion, we are looking for a
 **Head of Integrations** 
 that will lead and oversee the internal integration strategy and execution across our organization. This role involves managing a team to ensure seamless integration of systems, applications, and technologies that enhance operational efficiency and support business objectives.
   

  

**What We Need You To Do And Be**
 Bring your ideas. Challenge ours. Grow with us.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in designing, implementing, and optimizing integration solutions across departments and platforms.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute a comprehensive internal integration strategy aligned with business goals.
* Provide visionary leadership to the integration team, fostering innovation and efficiency.
* Lead, mentor, and develop a team of integration specialists and developers, building a collaborative and results-driven culture.
* Oversee the design and implementation of integrations between internal and external systems, ensuring data consistency and reliability.
* Stay curious about emerging technologies and industry best practices. Evaluate and recommend tools and solutions to enhance integration capabilities.
* Partner with IT, software development, and business stakeholders to understand integration needs. Work closely with vendors and third-party providers to ensure seamless delivery.
* Identify and mitigate integration risks, ensuring data security, compliance, and resilience.
* Maintain clear, comprehensive documentation of integration processes, configurations, and troubleshooting guides.


**What You’ll Bring To The Table**
 Our five values are our playbook. We speak up when things don’t make sense. We stop doing what doesn’t add value. We stay curious, back each other up, and make space for both innovation and laughter.
   

  

* Solid experience leading integration strategy and architecture in complex enterprise environments.
* Deep expertise in Azure Integration Services and a strong grasp of API design, event-driven architectures, and real-time data flows.
* Proven ability to lead and grow technical teams, driving collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Clear communicator who bridges business and technical perspectives with ease.
* Strategic thinker with a proactive, problem-solving mindset.
* Resilient and adaptable, thriving in a growing environment where processes are still taking shape.
* Curious about emerging technologies and how they can make integrations smarter and more efficient.
* Comfortable with using AI in your everyday work and developing the use of AI tools as a larger organizational strategy.
* Fluent in written and spoken English.


**What We See As An Advantage**
* Experience integrating Workday, Salesforce, NetSuite, or other large-scale enterprise systems.
* Azure certifications or equivalent experience with cloud integration platforms.
* Familiarity with data governance, security best practices, and cloud networking.
* Experience of working with an international team


**What We Offer In Return**
 You’ll be supported and given the space to thrive. We offer meaningful work, flexibility, and a culture that backs you to share your voice and be authentic.
   

  

* An international career and learning opportunities
* A rapidly growing and financially robust software company with exciting opportunities for career growth, also in the future


 These are the RELEX key benefits
   

  

* Flexible working
* Genuine work-life balance
* Annual leave
* Internet and mobile phone benefits
* Diverse, inclusive, and supportive work culture
* Meaningful work with a commitment to a more sustainable future
* High autonomy
* Room for creativity
* Strong team spirit through company parties, two team days per year, and after-work activities
* Family-oriented policies
* Flat hierarchies
* Two paid volunteering days each year


 We are a global community of different cultures, voices, and experiences. We celebrate what makes us unique and connect through what we share, in an authentic and safe environment. Together we shape the future, and each other.
   

  

 If you feel this is the opportunity you don’t want to miss, you can apply by sending your cover letter and resume through the application form as soon as possible.
   

  

*Please note that to be considered for this position, candidates must be based in Finland or Sweden and hold a valid work permit. We’re excited to connect with applicants who meet these criteria and share our passion for shaping the future together.*
**Apply today and be part of the future. Be RELEX!**

title: Head of Customer Success
description:
We’re looking for a technically minded Head of Customer Success to build and lead how Upsales drives value at scale, through systems, data, and smart automation. This is not a traditional CS role. It’s a chance to architect the frameworks, tools, and intelligence that define how our customers learn, grow, and succeed in the age of AI, with satisfied customers, high NPS, and a premium service experience as the ultimate outcome.
   

  

 At Upsales, we’re transforming B2B revenue acceleration with an AI-first platform that empowers thousands of European sales teams to grow faster and smarter. Now we’re scaling how we help customers realize that impact with precision, automation, and measurable success as the core, where NPS, customer sentiment, education quality, and advocacy are central metrics of success, not afterthoughts.
   

  

 AI first mindset
   

  

 We’re not looking for someone who simply uses AI. We want someone who weaponizes it. You treat tools like Claude, ChatGPT, and other AI copilots as force multipliers, allowing you to deliver at a level and speed others can’t match. For you, AI isn’t an add-on, it’s the default operating system for how you think, work, and lead. You’re relentlessly curious about new capabilities, and you push the limits of what’s possible, turning AI into a competitive advantage for yourself, Upsales, and our customers. This is a role for someone with real ambition: someone who wants to set a new standard for efficiency, precision, service quality, and impact in the age of AI.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

 You’ll take full ownership of the customer success ecosystem: designing technical systems and experiences that are both scalable and human.
   

  

* Build a world-class customer success infrastructure powered by data, automation, and AI, explicitly optimised to strengthen NPS, customer sentiment, and trust.
* Redefine self-service with intelligent documentation, contextual help, and proactive support, ensuring customers always feel informed, empowered, and supported — key drivers of high NPS.
* Design and deliver digital education programs, training, and scalable value-driven journeys that measurably increase customer confidence and satisfaction.
* Integrate customer insights, feedback, reviews, and NPS data directly into product and AI models to drive smarter decision-making and deeper customer alignment.
* Leverage analytics, telemetry, and feedback loops to continuously improve adoption, retention, and expansion, with NPS and qualitative satisfaction as primary indicators of success.
* Lead and mentor the CS team to operate with precision, ownership, and technical depth, while instilling a culture obsessed with customer happiness, follow-through, and excellence.


 This is a role where systems thinking meets customer obsession. You’ll be hands-on with tools, data, and workflows, shaping not just customer relationships, but the technology that powers them, always reinforcing a journey that increases satisfaction, produces positive reviews, and drives long-term loyalty. You’ll collaborate with product, marketing, and support leaders to make sure our customer journey is both seamless and memorable, consistently strengthening NPS and overall customer delight. Together, you’ll build one of the most effective and forward-thinking customer success organizations in the market.
   

  

 Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can reinvent how customer success is done… are the ones who actually do.
   

  

 Who We're Looking For
   

  

* We’re looking for someone who has already proven they can lead and scale customer success in a SaaS environment.
* Experience with AI-enabled tools or analytics platforms, using them to enhance efficiency, prediction, personalization, and to identify the drivers behind high NPS and customer delight.
* A systems builder: comfortable defining processes, mapping journeys, and translating complexity into clarity, always grounded in what creates happy, confident customers.
* Equally fluent in strategy and execution, from designing scalable CS frameworks to implementing automation yourself.
* You know how to connect customer voice with business strategy, turning insights into loyalty, advocacy, reviews, measurable improvements in NPS, and product innovation.
* Personality-wise? You’re a builder, a doer, and customer-obsessed. You combine sharp business sense with a love of operational excellence, and an instinct for service, attitude, and communication that makes customers genuinely love working with us. You don’t just raise the bar, you create new standards, and bring others with you.
* You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in Swedish and English.


 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: IT-tekniker sökes! Spännande uppdrag hos kund i hjärtat av Stockholm.
description:
Vad innebär det att vara IT-tekniker hos kund?
   

  

 Vi söker en IT-tekniker med erfarenhet av IT-support, systemadministration och enhetshantering till ett uppdrag i Stockholm. Du kommer att arbeta heltid på plats och via fjärrsupport, med fokus på att ge tekniskt stöd till användare och hantera både Windows- och Apple-enheter i en hybridmiljö.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ge support via walk-in, remote och onsite för användare i verksamheten
* Administrera Office 365, Exchange, Azure AD och Active Directory (on-prem)
* Hantera enheter via Intune och Jamf, inklusive installation och uppdatering av PC, Mac och iOS
* Felsöka buggar, kraschrapporter och tekniska problem, inklusive Citrix Workspace
* Ansvara för videokonferensutrustning samt inköp av hårdvara


**Vad söker vi hos dig?**
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av liknande teknikerroll
* God kunskap om Windows, Office 365 och Active Directory
* Erfarenhet av Intune och ärendehantering
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Du är serviceinriktad IT tekniker


 PASSAR VI DIG?
   

  

 Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT. Vår uppgift är att hitta rätt person till rätt IT-jobb, genom rekrytering och konsulter. Vi tror på människan i en framtida teknikutveckling och brinner för att bygga relationer, inkludera fler i IT-branschen och naturligtvis matcha rätt kompetens till rätt uppdrag. Vi vill vara en självklar go-to career partner oavsett om kandidaten söker jobb i dagsläget eller inte. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Läs mer om oss, vår kultur och våra värderingar på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 ANSÖKAN
   

  

 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.

title: Business Development Intern
description:
🚀 Internship Opportunity: Sales & Marketing (AI & Tech Consulting)
 



 📍 Stockholm / Hybrid
 



 🗓 Start: Immediate | Duration: 6 months
 



  





 Are you curious about AI, GenAI and Agentic AI—and excited by the idea of bringing cutting-edge technology to market? Do you love creating content, running campaigns and confidently talking about the future of business and AI?
 



  





 Digisource Consulting AB is looking for driven, self-motivated interns to join our Sales & Marketing team as we expand our footprint across the Nordics and the USA. This is your chance to be part of a fast-growing consulting company working at the intersection of AI, business and innovation.
 



  





  




 🌟 What’s in it for you?
 
  




* Real exposure to B2B sales & marketing in the IT and consulting industry
* Hands-on experience with AI in business, not just theory
* Work closely with senior consultants on:
* Lead generation & prospecting
* Digital and social media campaigns
* AI-driven go-to-market initiatives
* A flexible, collaborative culture that values initiative, creativity and ownership
* Experience with a company working closely with Amazon (AWS), Microsoft and Google in the AI ecosystem



  





**💬** 
*Previous interns describe their time at Digisource as “enriching, fast-paced and exciting.”* 




  





  




 🔍 Who we’re looking for
 
  





**You are curious, ambitious and ready to learn. Ideally, you have:** 




  




* An interest and basic understanding of AI, Generative AI and Agentic AI
* Strong social media skills (especially LinkedIn, plus Instagram/X)
* Fluent in Swedish and English (written and spoken)
* Excellent communication skills and the confidence to express ideas clearly
* A self-driven mindset: proactive, creative and solution-oriented
* A background (or current studies) in Business, Marketing, IT or related fields



  





  





**This is an unpaid internship, but it offers exceptional learning, mentorship and hands-on experience in a rapidly growing consulting environment.** 




**High-performing interns may be considered for future roles or receive strong recommendations within our network.** 




  





  




 🤖 About Digisource Consulting AB
 
  





**Digisource Consulting AB is a Stockholm-based, innovation-driven consulting company helping organizations transform through AI, Agentic AI, Generative AI, Cloud and digital platforms.** 




  





**We have delivered AI-enabled solutions across areas such as:** 




  




* AI in HR & enterprise functions
* Cloud-native and scalable architectures
* Data-driven decision-making
* Digital transformation and automation



  





**Our work focuses on turning emerging technologies into real business impact—improving efficiency, enabling smarter processes and creating future-ready organizations.** 




  





**🔗 Learn more: https://www.digisourceconsulting.com/**

title: Technical Support Representative
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to make it happen. You’ll solve challenges, deliver solutions and develop new, efficient processes that make a direct impact on our customers’ lives.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a Technical Support Representative, you will join our multilingual Technical Support team to whom users, professionals and partners turn to when in need of help. In this experience, you will be the voice of Tobii Dynavox to our users and partners in the United Kingdom and Ireland markets and deliver high-quality technical support, while gaining in-depth knowledge of our diverse portfolio of products.
   

  

 While your previous work experience is important, we also value finding a strong cultural fit. You don't need to be an IT expert, however, we greatly appreciate your curiosity and interest in technology, and your familiarity with using both Windows and Apple products. If you enjoy helping people and solving problems through collaboration and technology, you can contribute significantly and thrive in this role!
   

  

**Please note:** 
 This is a full-time, permanent and
 **onsite** 
 role at our office in
 **city** 
 . Our working hours are
 **9am-6pm** 
 from Monday to Friday.
   

  

  

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Assist customers, partners, and internal colleagues with any technical inquiries and supporting requests about our products. Build understanding of product features, functionalities and best practices, empowering them to resolve issues independently.
* Troubleshoot issues across our hardware and software platforms via phone, email, chat and remote desktop sessions, collaborating with developers and other stakeholders when necessary.
* Nurture and maintain strong customer relationships by demonstrating empathy, patience, and commitment to their success, whatever that looks like for them.
* Collaborate with our marketing team to monitor our social media channels.
* Assist in the development and maintenance of technical documentation such as articles, FAQs, and user guides tailored for target regions.


  

  

**What We're Looking For:**
* Educational background in relevant fields such as Speech-Language Pathology and Linguistics is preferred.
* Previous experience in customer-facing role such as customer service, technical or product support. Familiarity with Windows and/or iOS environment is a great asset.
* Experience with CRM and ERP systems (such as Salesforce or Dynamics) is a great asset.
* Empathic approach and skills in problem solving and active listening to resolve technical issues while maintaining high customer satisfaction are required.
* Communication and collaboration skills to interact with tech-savvy people while making computer novices feel supported and understood.
* Proficiency in written and spoken English is required.


**Please note:** 
 This position is not an engineering or IT development role. We are looking for someone with a technical foundation and strong troubleshooting ability, but above all, a customer-focused mindset. Success in this role comes from your ability to listen empathetically, communicate clearly, and support users with patience and care—not from advanced programming or hardware engineering skills.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: SAP Program Director
description:
**Role:** 
 SAP Program Director
 



**Experience (Years):** 
 17+ Years
 



**Language requirement:** 
 Swedish & English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Must-Have:** 




  





**1) Program Leadership:** 




  




* Lead and oversee SAP conversion program and optimization projects, ensuring they align with overall business objectives and deliver value to the organization.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across the business to secure their involvement and commitment throughout the project.



  





**2) Business Alignment:** 




  




* Ensure that the program’s goals are closely aligned with the company’s strategic business objectives.
* Work closely with senior executives and business leaders to understand their needs and ensure these are reflected in the SAP implementation.



  





**3) Communication Strategy:** 




  




* Develop and execute comprehensive communication plans to keep all stakeholders informed and engaged.
* Ensure that project updates, milestones, and changes are effectively communicated across the organization.



  





**4) Project Management:** 




  




* Oversee the day-to-day management of the SAP program, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Identify, manage, and mitigate project risks and issues to ensure successful project outcomes.



  





**5) Performance Monitoring:** 




  




* Track and report on program performance, providing regular updates to senior management.
* Ensure that all deliverables meet the required quality standards and business requirements.



  





**Experience required:** 




  




* Proven experience as a Senior Program Director or Senior Project Director, with a strong track record of leading large-scale SAP implementation and optimization projects.
* Experience in aligning complex IT projects with business objectives in a global or multinational company.



  





**Skills:** 




  




* Excellent English language skills, both written and spoken.
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Expertise in developing and executing communication strategies for large projects.
* Deep understanding of SAP systems and their implementation in large organizations.



  





**Technical Skills:** 




  




* Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies.
* Strong understanding of SAP software, particularly in implementation and optimization contexts.



  





**Good to have:** 




  




* Strong SAP S/4 implementation Experience
* Knowledge in Retail business



  





**Responsibility of / Expectations from the Role** 




  




* Proven experience as a Senior Program Director or Senior Project Director, with a strong track record of leading
* Experience in aligning complex IT projects with business objectives in a global or multinational company
* Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies
* Deep understanding of SAP systems and their implementation in large organizations
* Should be focused in on-time delivery



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **ajay.androw@tcs.com**

title: Cloud Workspace Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose smoke-free enjoyment. How? By offering people other nicotine products online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with eleven store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 300 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to smoke-free alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Ready to transform the way we work?
   

  

 At Haypp, we’re building smarter, faster, and more secure IT environments and we want you on our team. As our Cloud Workspace Engineer, you’ll design and deliver cutting-edge cloud solutions that keep us agile and ahead of the curve. If you thrive on solving complex challenges, automating processes, and collaborating across teams, this is your chance to make a real impact.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Your role as a Cloud Workspace Engineer and IT generalist will be diverse and hands-on. You’ll:
   

  

* Design and deploy cloud workspaces using Microsoft technologies like Azure AD, Office 365, and SharePoint.
* Secure and manage endpoints with Microsoft Intune, Defender, and Purview, ensuring compliance and a seamless user experience across Windows, MacOS, and mobile platforms.
* Identity & Access Management (IAM) and maintain Single Sign-On (SSO) and MFA across internal and third-party applications.
* Drive IT projects that make our systems scalable, compliant, and future-ready, whether migrating legacy systems or rolling out new SaaS solutions.
* Automate repetitive tasks using scripting (PowerShell, Bash, Python), from user provisioning to compliance reporting.
* Maintain and improve IT documentation, including troubleshooting guides and disaster recovery playbooks.
* Support cross-functional initiatives, such as integrating new business apps, optimizing collaboration tools, and enabling secure remote work.
* Monitor and optimize cloud performance, conduct audits, and implement best practices for data protection and disaster recovery.


**Examples Of Projects You Might Managed**
* Migrating legacy systems to Microsoft 365 for a modern, cloud-first workplace.
* Rolling out Zero Trust security architecture, including conditional access and MFA.
* Automating employee onboarding workflows with scripts for provisioning accounts and devices.
* Implementing advanced compliance and data protection measures using Microsoft Purview.
* Integrating new SaaS applications with seamless SSO and IAM configurations.
* Optimizing Teams and SharePoint for better collaboration in hybrid teams.
* Developing disaster recovery strategies and conducting failover tests.
* Building dashboards for IT asset management and security posture monitoring.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proficiency in Azure and Microsoft 365 tools and services.
* Experience in Windows endpoint management; MacOS, iOS, and Android knowledge is a plus.
* Expertise in IAM and SSO federation protocols.
* Familiarity with IT Service Management and Asset Management.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or equivalent experience.
* Certifications like Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert is a plus.


**You Will Thrive Here If You**
* Likes taking ownership and thrives on responsibility, someone who sees challenges as opportunities to deliver impact.
* Has a strong commitment to quality and security, ensuring every solution is reliable and future-proof.
* Is proactive and resourceful, always looking for ways to improve processes and automate repetitive tasks.
* Brings collaboration and adaptability, working seamlessly with different teams and stakeholders.
* Maintains a continuous learning mindset, staying ahead of tech trends and embracing innovation.


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *Inclusion and Non-Hierarchy* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With 11 e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: Senior Technical Program Manager
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 As a
 **Senior Technical Program Manager for AI Evaluations** 
 , you’ll drive the strategy and execution of our evaluation efforts from inception to release. You will own the evals roadmap end-to-end in partnership with product and engineering to enable faster and better product delivery. You’ll also coordinate across internal stakeholders and external vendors to plan, track, and deliver initiatives, while implementing monitoring systems and analyzing outcomes to translate insights into actionable feedback.
   

  

 As our platform scales rapidly, you’ll play a central role in building a world-class evaluation function that ensures the performance, reliability, and integrity of our product matches our ambition.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Manage evaluation projects end-to-end: own timelines, deliverables and internal and external resources across the full range of evaluation needs and initiatives.
* Define evaluation objectives, methods, and success criteria in partnership with product, engineering and legal engineering teams.
* Interface with cross-functional teams to ensure evaluation strategies are not only aligned with product goals and technical capabilities but also actively facilitate the creation of evaluations to enable faster and better product delivery.
* Coordinate external contributors, from legal experts and research partners to client companies, and integrate their input into evaluations that drive capabilities. You’ll define scopes, onboard contributors, and ensure high-quality outputs that meet technical and product standards.
* Evaluate and translate results of evaluation into real improvements for the product and engineering.


**Who You Are**
* Strong academic background in business, data or engineering and related fields, with a degree from a top-tier university.
* 5+ years of experience as a management consultant, product manager, lead program manager or a similar strategy-driven role in fast growing organizations.
* Proven track record of successfully delivering complex projects, including stakeholder management and cross-functional coordination.
* Experience in solving large-scale, ambiguous problem sets and bringing structure and clarity while delivering on key objectives.
* Excellent communicator who can simplify and align technical and business goals.
* Interest in and understanding of AI models, evaluation methods, and AI product development.
* Energized by building from scratch — hands-on, pragmatic, and motivated by getting things over the line. You don’t get hung up on details, but push through to get things done.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: 业务助理
company: Bank of China (Europe) S.A. Stockholm Branch
description:
Bank of China Limited is one of the biggest and most internationalized banks in China. Bank of China (Europe) S.A. Stockholm Branch was established in Sweden 2012. It is the first Chinese-funded Bank officially registered in Sweden and doing business in the Nordic area. We now plan to recruit Business Assistant /Officer in Business Management Department in the Stockholm Branch.
 



  





 Job Description
 



  





 Procurement & Supplier Support
 



 • Support procurement initiation and implementation, including preparation of requests, coordination with suppliers, and documentation submission in line with internal policies.
 



 • Maintain accurate procurement and purchasing records.
 



 • Handle reimbursement and expense submissions for purchases made 
 



 • Assist with ongoing supplier and contract management, including data maintenance in internal systems.
 



 • Support required supplier screenings and prepare regular or ad-hoc data and reports as requested by Head Office or Parent Bank.
 



  





 Office Operations & General Support
 



 • Coordinate employee travel arrangements and related logistics in accordance with branch policies and cost guidelines.
 



 • Support daily office operations, including facilities coordination and general administrative tasks.
 



 • Assist with internal activities and corporate events that promote employee engagement and a positive workplace culture.
 



 • Provide other general and ad-hoc support to the Executive Office as required.
 



  





 Documentation & Records Administration
 



 • Support basic documentation management, including handling incoming and outgoing correspondence and maintaining proper filing and record-keeping.
 



 • Assist with archive registration, sorting, storage, and annual inventory under the guidance of the manager.
 



  





 Basic Requirements
 



 • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, Information Technology, or other relevant disciplines.
 



 • 1–2 years of relevant experience in operations, administration, procurement, office management, or a similar role.
 



 • Experience working in an international or multicultural environment; knowledge of Chinese/Asian culture is considered an advantage.
 



 • Fluent in written and spoken English; proficiency in Chinese and/or Swedish is a plus.
 



 • An IT-related background, enabling the candidate to support IT-related matters and provide backup coverage for the IT Manager when needed, is considered a strong advantage.
 



  





 Personal Competencies
 



 You are well-organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks. You demonstrate good communication and teamwork skills, maintain a positive and proactive attitude, and can work effectively in a dynamic work environment.
 



  
 



 Application
 



 Since the selection and interviewing is ongoing; please submit your Cover letter and CV in English as soon as possible to e-mail: hr.se@bankofchina.com.
 



 All applications will be kept confidential. If you have questions about the position please contact Shelly Zhu via e-mail: hr.se@bankofchina.com. We look forward to your application!

title: Backend Engineers, Discovery
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for passionate and product-minded Backend Engineers to join our Discovery team - the group behind some of the most visible and impactful parts of Wolt’s consumer app. You’ll work on features that help millions of users discover their next favorite restaurant, grocery store, or product- from the homepage and category views to new vertical experiences like groceries, electronics, pet food, and health & beauty.
   

  

 This is more than just a backend engineering role. We’re looking for someone who combines strong technical skills with curiosity, ownership, and a deep interest in creating meaningful user experiences at scale. We have a few open positions on this team, and we're looking to hire both an early-career engineer (around 2+ years of experience) as well as more seasoned engineers.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Design, build, and operate high-performance backend services - primarily in Kotlin, Python and/or Go- powering discovery surfaces, front pages, and category experiences across Wolt’s new and existing verticals.
* Own your services end-to-end with your tema: from requirements, design, and delivery to testing, CI/CD, deployment, monitoring, and on-call.
* Translate product and user needs into scalable, low-latency solutions and run experiments (A/B tests, feature flags) to continuously improve performance and impact.
* Collaborate closely with Product Leads, Frontend, Data, and Machine Learning teams to build features like search, ranking, personalization, and data-pipeline integrations.
* Drive reliability, observability, and efficiency - through automated testing, logging, tracing, alerting, incident response, and post-mortems.
* Continuously improve technical quality by reducing tech debt, proposing architectural improvements, and measuring their outcomes.


**Our humble expectations:**
 We’re looking for someone with:
   

  

* Backend development experience in one or more of the following languages: Kotlin (or modern Java), Python, or Go.
* A strong ownership mindset - someone proactive, curious, and eager to understand how things work under the hood.
* A product- and customer-focused approach, with a pragmatic attitude toward solving real user problems.
* Excellent communications skills in English.


 Why You’ll Love Working Here:
   

  

* Make an impact: Build features used by millions across multiple countries.
* Own it end-to-end: Design, build, and operate high-performance backend services with real product impact.
