title: System Configuration Expert for Loan IQ | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you want to work with system configuration for syndicated loans? We need you and your skills!
   

  

 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while we place a strong emphasis on sustainability and digitalization as we shape the future of SEB.
   

  

 As a part of the SEB Group, Business Services provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Business Services consistently strive to enhance business development and growth. If you want to be part of an engaging and enabling environment where you can turn your everyday actions into global results, this is where you get to shine.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In Structured Loan Services (SLS) we handle syndicated loans for Corporate & Institutional Banking .
   

  

 In the SLS Development Team we are currently two process developers with process focus, three system configuration experts with system focus and one business analyst.
   

  

 As a System Configuration Expert in Loan IQ you are working closely with Loan IQ Tech Team, Finance, Treasury, Business Services (BS) teams as well as the vendor and other internal teams depending on the project. You are acting as link between several departments in your daily work and take responsibility for improvements and developments. You will actively drive and participate to projects in the area.
   

  

 This role requires a proactive mindset. You often create your own tasks and it is expected to identify opportunities, initiate improvements, and drive change. If you enjoy taking ownership and creating structure in a dynamic environment, this is the role for you.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* Excellent knowledge in LoanIQ and Experience from testing Loan IQ or.
* Knowledge in system configuration and financial accounting flows.
* Very good communication and networking ability.
* Excellent knowledge of English is required.
* Be customer-focused, have a high risk awareness.
* Be results-oriented, proactive and focused on driving innovation and change.
* Experience of driving and participating in projects.
* Basic understanding of SQL, XML and SDK would be considered as advantage.
* Business requirement writing for banking system.


 What we offer
   

  

* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Remote working possibilities.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than January 4, 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Mimmie Hedman via email mimmie.hedman@seb.se. Please note that the recruitment process is prolonged due to the holidays.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Design and Test Engineer at Venture & New business
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in contributing to this vision. We drive the industry transformation: At Ventures and New Business we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Role Summary
   

  

 We are looking for an engaged and skilled
 **Hardware Design Engineer** 
 who wants to work with mechanical design, electrical components and testing. You will work with both low- and high-voltage systems as well as cable management and sheet metal development.
   

  

 In this role, you will combine
 **hands-on technical work with planning and coordination** 
 , giving you a unique opportunity to influence quality and performance in our solutions. You will be part of a collaborative team alongside hardware designers, software engineers, and power electronics specialists.
   

  

 Familiarity with Scania’s product development process is considered a merit.
   

  

 We are seeking someone with experience in testing and mechanical design who enjoys working cross-functionally within R&D. The role also requires strategic thinking and the ability to create clarity and momentum in a dynamic environment.
   

  

 Job Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Design and develop sheet metal components with integrated electronic systems together with our lead engineer
* Plan and execute tests according to project timelines
* Develop prototypes and support testing and validation activities
* Communicate effectively with suppliers and external partners to ensure technical quality
* Ensure compliance with standards and Scania’s PD process
* Collaborate with software and power electronics engineers to deliver integrated system solutions


 Who You Are
   

  

 You have several years of experience in product development and a broad technical perspective gained from working across different R&D domains. You are
 **proactive, solution-oriented, and thrive in an environment where innovation and collaboration are key** 
 .
   

  

 We believe you:
   

  

  

* Hold a relevant university degree in mechanical engineering, mechatronics, or similar
* Have a structured and proactive approach to planning and execution
* Bring hands-on experience with testing, prototyping, and validation
* Communicate clearly and build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
* Enjoy contributing to strategic discussions and long-term product development
* Have experience working cross-functionally with purchasing, production, and sales & marketing
* Have worked in early-stage or entrepreneurial settings, preferably within charging infrastructure


 This Is Us
   

  

 Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it’s a change we want to lead. At Ventures and New business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that can accelerate us in driving the shift.
   

  

 People are core to our business. By joining our journey towards a sustainable transport system, you are contributing to the future of transport. You are part of a team that can create real change. At Ventures and New Business, we want to engage and inspire our full organization to create results together with us. Collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit is part of our culture and what makes us successful.
   

  

 By joining us you will be a part of driving meaningful growth in new ways!
   

  

 Scania Offers
   

  

 We offer you the chance to be part of an organization that is focused on reaching Scania’s targets and to truly drive the industry transformation. People who work here have the motivation and desire to constantly make things better.
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options. Our office is located in central Stockholm at Drottninggatan and at Tomteboda. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-12-18. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 linda.rosenqvist@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Test Engineer/Truck Driver (CE License)
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Skillhuset is a Stockholm-based IT consulting firm focused on connecting highly skilled professionals with leading companies across Sweden and Europe. Committed to delivering top-quality expertise in niche technologies, Skillhuset prioritizes creating value through competitive solutions and fostering long-term partnerships with clients and consultants. With an additional branch in India, Skillhuset provides remote consulting services, offering clients access to quality talent at reduced costs. Whether you are seeking expertise for your organization or pursuing new opportunities, Skillhuset is your partner for growth, innovation, and success.
   

  

**Role Description**
  

 This is a full-time, on-site role in Södertälje for a Test Engineer/Truck Driver (CE License). The role involves executing diverse testing activities on trucks and their components, including functional testing and test execution. The Test Engineer/Truck Driver will create, execute, and evaluate test cases while documenting results to improve performance and compliance with industry standards. Precise handling of vehicles under testing conditions and reporting technical findings to ensure product reliability and safety are central to this role.
   

  

**Qualifications**
  

* Proficiency in Test Engineering and Test Execution techniques
* Strong skills in creating and evaluating Test Cases
* Experience in Testing, including Functional Testing
* A valid CE driving license and proven ability to operate trucks
* Attention to detail and strong problem-solving capabilities
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team and communicate testing results effectively
* Prior experience in the automotive or transportation industry is an advantage
* Technical certification or relevant qualifications in engineering is a plus

title: System Engineer Security
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 Over 40% of the world’s mobile traffic is carried through an Ericsson network. Ericsson is the recognized technology leader in bringing to market the 5th generation (5G) of Radio Access Networks (RAN) and Mobile Core Networks. The foundation for 5G use cases is built through an agile cloud environment distributed throughout the network coverage area.
   

  

 Software Defined Infrastructure (SDI) is the automated equipment management component that enables an agile private cloud, and our team owns the system and software architecture that makes this happen. We are recruiting a security-focused engineer to take responsibility for product security during software development activities for the SDI3 product. You will manage risks, support audits and certifications, ensure compliance, document the product’s security and data privacy posture, conduct system studies, and contribute to security-related features. You will also represent SDI3 security internally and with customer support and pre-sales teams, providing clear, actionable analyses of the product’s security posture.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Own and drive the security posture of the SDI3 product across the software development lifecycle
* Manage security and privacy risks and support audits for secure development certifications
* Ensure compliance with internal requirements, industry standards, and applicable regulations
* Document the product’s security and data privacy posture in line with Ericsson ways of working
* Perform security-focused analyses, including threat modeling and risk assessments
* Contribute to the design and development of security features for SDI3
* Embed security-by-design and security-by-default principles with development teams
* Coordinate vulnerability management, including identification, assessment, and remediation
* Represent SDI3 in security discussions with internal stakeholders, customer support, and pre-sales
* Provide clear security posture analyses in response to customer and market requirements
* Promote best practices and foster a strong security culture across the organization
* Act as a subject-matter expert on standards, tools, and secure development practices


**The skills you bring:**
* MSc in Cybersecurity or Security Management, or a degree in Computer Science, Network Engineering, or related field with relevant secure development experience
* 10+ years in cybersecurity roles, including 5+ years partnering with software development teams
* Deep knowledge of cybersecurity and risk assessment, including vulnerability assessment and preferably penetration testing for applications and network infrastructure
* Strong knowledge of software/system security standards and regulations (e.g., 3GPP/NESAS) and technologies such as TLS, SSH, LDAP, and security testing tools
* Ability to engage and influence diverse technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex security topics to non-specialists
* Preferred certifications: CISSP, CISM


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Learn more.
   

  

 We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 9th January 2026.
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Forward Deployed Software Engineer
description:
**A World-Changing Company**
 Palantir builds the world’s leading software for data-driven decisions and operations. By bringing the right data to the people who need it, our platforms empower our partners to develop lifesaving drugs, forecast supply chain disruptions, locate missing children, and more.
   

  

**The Role**
 Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) work directly with customers to quickly understand their greatest problems and design and implement solutions to use data against them. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like “Why are we delaying so many flights?” or “How can we better identify instances of money laundering?” As an FDSE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.
   

  

 As an FDSE your responsibilities look similar to those of a startup CTO: you’ll work in small teams with minimal supervision and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects. Your day might span discussing architecture with fellow engineers, wrangling massive-scale data, coding a custom web app, speaking with customer executives, or establishing strategy for your team.
   

  

 Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.
   

  

**Our Principles**
* Impact: We take on meaningful and challenging projects that change the world for the better.
* Ownership: We see projects through from beginning to end, working through any obstacles we may encounter.
* Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds — such as other FDSEs, product teams, and Deployment Strategists. We also work externally with our customers, often on-site, to understand and solve their problems.
* Trust: We trust each other to effectively manage time and priorities and give people the space to think for themselves.
* Growth: We encourage ourselves and our peers to seek new challenges and opportunities for growth, as well as find new ways to innovate and share knowledge.
* Learning: We often face entirely novel problems where we need to pick up a lot of new knowledge and learn how to use it to make progress. We believe experiential learning is one of the best teachers.


**What We Value**
* A highly analytical mindset and eagerness to solve technical problems with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
* Experience or interest in working with and using large scale data to solve valuable business problems.
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals, and comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
* Ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.


**What We Require**
* 1+ years of relevant, post-college work experience.
* Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics, and Data Science.
* Strong coder with shown proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, C++, TypeScript/JavaScript, or similar.
* Ability and interest to travel up to 25%, as needed to client sites, but flexible based on personal preferences.
* Security clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance.
* Swedish language fluency.


**Life at Palantir**
 We want every Palantirian to achieve their best outcomes, that’s why we celebrate individuals’ strengths, skills, and interests, from your first interview to your longterm growth, rather than rely on traditional career ladders. Paying attention to the needs of our community enables us to optimize our opportunities to grow and helps ensure many pathways to success at Palantir. Promoting health and well-being across all areas of Palantirians’ lives is just one of the ways we’re investing in our community. Learn more at Life at Palantir and note that our offerings may vary by region.
   

  

 In keeping consistent with Palantir’s values and culture, we believe employees are “better together” and in-person work affords the opportunity for more creative outcomes. Therefore, we encourage employees to work from our offices to foster connectivity and innovation. Many teams do offer hybrid options (WFH a day or two a week), allowing our employees to strike the right trade-off for their personal productivity. Based on business need, there are a few roles that allow for “Remote” work on an exceptional basis. If you are applying for one of these roles, you must work from the city and or country in which you are employed. If the posting is specified as Onsite, you are required to work from an office.
   

  

 If you want to empower the world's most important institutions, you belong here. Palantir values excellence regardless of background. We are committed to making the application and hiring process accessible to everyone and will provide a reasonable accommodation for those living with a disability. If you need an accommodation for the application or hiring process
 *,* 
 please reach out and let us know how we can help.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson is transforming the way software is built — and AI is at the heart of this shift.
   

  

 BCSS’s Innovation unit is now expanding with Senior Data Scientists and Senior Data Engineers who will focus on AI, Agentic AI, ML, and domain-specific LLMs to boost development efficiency.
   

  

 You’ll work with cutting-edge technologies alongside highly skilled experts in an environment designed for learning, experimentation, productification and impact.
   

  

 BCSS Innovation brings together Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and AI Architects to push Ericsson’s productivity and developer experience forward, through advanced AI capabilities. To succeed, we combine telecommunication specifics with the latest AI technology to create true end-to-end solutions.
   

  

 AI-driven development is redefining Ericsson, and this is your chance to influence both direction and speed. We’re pushing the boundaries — and we want you with us.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Act as a technology leader and help identify the AI technologies most critical to Ericsson’s software development efficiency.
* Explore opportunities, Innovative solutions and drive end-to-end development — from early feasibility to solutions in full operation.
* Contribute to automation in software development and design scalable AI applications used across the organization.
* Continuously grow your expertise while collaborating with highly skilled colleagues, academia, vendors, and open-source communities.


**The skills you bring:**
* Strong expertise in AI and software development
* MSc or PhD in a relevant field
* ~5 years’ experience in software development, cloud technologies, and data science/data engineering
* Practical experience with GenAI, fine-tuning, retrieval models, small LLMs, and vector databases
* Hands-on experience with Agentic AI (e.g. AWS Bedrock AgentCore) and protocols (e.g. MCP and A2A)
* Deep knowledge of ML techniques (e.g., regression models, Bayesian methods, neural networks, random forests, hyperparameter optimization, knowledge graphs)
* Proven experience building AI/ML applications with frameworks like Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow
* Experience with Big Data processing
* Strong programming skills (Python, C++, Scala, Java, R)
* Excellent written and spoken English
* Strong analytical ability, creativity, and independence
* Collaborative, communicative, and easy to work with


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Telecommunication knowledge
* Experience in developing AI solutions for applications/products
* Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities
* Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs


**What to Include in Your Cover Letter:**
* The AI achievements you’re most proud of, including your specific role and the impact you made on the projects.
* Any experience turning prototypes into scalable AI products


**About the Role:**
* Onsite three days per week to enable to work closely with highly experienced technical experts and for strong team collaboration (Kista, Stockholm)
* This is a senior role, but we can make an opening for an outstanding junior candidate as well
* Applications reviewed continuously; and recruitment might be finalized before the last day to apply, which is January 7


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
